40856635.review:
[h1]The Castle Cast A Spell On You[/h1]

Castle of Illusion is a modern re-do of an 8-bit genesis platformer that came out in 1990.  Sega have gone back, applied a little modern polish, changed up the graphics and done a number on the music to make it a more appealing game for the curent age.

if you're looking for a fairly laid back, fairly simple little game, then I completely recommend this, with one or two small caveats.

[b]How It Works[/b]

In Castle of Illusion, you are Mickey Mouse.  You're out on a picnic with your sweetheart, Minnie when the evil witch Mizrabel swoops down, captures Minnie and spirits her off to her realm - her Castle of Illusion.  Mickey [and you, as the player] have to infiltrate the castle, dispense with the illusions and save Minnie from Mizrabel's clutches before she steals your lady friend's youth so she can be beautiful once more.

To do this, you hop over obstacles and traverse varied levels that are inhabited by bad critters.  Lots of these can be dispatched with various throwing items [from paint to strawberries], but, if you feel like you need a slight boost in your jump, you can also hop on top of any critter to kill it, lending you an extra spring in your step.

To this end, and for the most part, Castle of Illusion is a very laid back and quite forgiving platformer.  Most jumps are easy enough to make, provided you hold your jump button down and aim in the right direction, but if you get [i]good[/i] at the jumps and you try to chain them together, you may find that your controller of choice loses an input or two along the way.

As you scurry from entry to exit point, you will discover diamonds.  Parts of the Castle are gated off behind a certain number of diamonds.  Once you acquire these, you'll be able to go through those formerly locked doors, provided you also obtain the rainbow gem that aligns with the new area by beating the previous area's boss.

This makes Castle of Illusion a fairly linear affair - at first, I was quite worried about going into some place that was too far advanced for my jumping skills, but you just can't do that.  The game simply won't allow it.

Each world has little extra collectible treasures that you can hunt for:

Donald's Chilli Peppers eventually grant you access to different costumes you can dress Mickey in
Diamonds and Statues each get you new castle pieces to look at.  [Art and pedestals, respectively.]

Though, for beating the game, neither of these is strictly necessary.

[b]But...how is the underlying game?[/b]

I wish I could give games like this a "mixed" review, but I can't.  Castle of Illusion is a great middle of the road game that's fine on a lazy weekend when you have nothing else to play, but it's certainly not going to "that one great game you remember for the next twenty years."

For one thing, that lack of responsiveness when you get good with the jumping is problematic.  For another, there's one or two areas that I really didn't like from a design perspective [mainly because these drag out that good old platform game chesnut, the unkillable enemy.  In an underwater section, to boot.]  Then there's those one or two frustrating jumps to get at a particular collectible coupled with a somewhat absurd boss fight and all of these things add up to make the game lose a fair few points [if this review had a score.]

Do I like it and can I recommend it?  Yeah.  But most certainly not at full price.  The new art is quite nice and the new soundtrack is pretty good, and the voice acting is a little hammy but mostly spot on.  Plus, it's a low-key game you can finish in a sitting or two.

[b]Pros At A Glance[/b]
[list]
[*]Great update:  The sound, graphics and animations all flow rather well.
[*][i]Very[/i] laid back game:  there's no timers [unless you want them], death is almost unobtrusive and it's generally an easy-going experience.
[*]The narrator [and voice cast] are hammy, but good:  That so southern accent on the narrator is quite easy on the ears.
[/list]

[b]Cons At A Glance[/b]
[list]
[*]Can be sometimes fidgety:  you land!  You try to jump again quite soon after!  You fail and die!  The controls can be a tiny bit iffy.
[*]Occasional unskippable cut scene.  You died!  Now watch this cut scene again.  And again. And again.
[*]One or two miserable [pardon the pun] sections:  The underwater fish section.  Urgh.  That one jump to get that one castle statue.  Urgh.  That last boss fight had a LOT going on toward it's final phase.
[/list]

As I say:  If you're interested, I'd take the plunge, but on a sale and knowing that this isn't going to be a very long game.

40820181.review:
No offence, dear nostalgic SEGA consoles gamers, but this game simply doesn't work for me. I was always a PlayStation child. This remake is a good game, but I find myself pretty bored playing it. Maybe if I would be younger - It would make the difference and the game would take a place in my heart. It has a really good picture, catchy soundtrack, interesting (yet a bit cliche) story, good game design in most cases, but...

But I can't really enjoy the game with Mickey, stupidly giggling at almost everything when according to the story he is literally racing the time to save his beloved Minnie (everyone has their choices, right? I always prefered Darkwing Duck and DuckTales. Even the games with Donald were good enough).

Other things that I noticed during the game and didn't really like. 
1. Finicky controls. Really. Why would you use arrow keys or ESDF, when there is always loyal WASD at your side? Also, the shooting part of the game... Not ideal.
2. Only XBOX controller is supported. Meh.
3. Wierd enemy hit-boxes. You will sometimes find yourself jumping from an angle atop on an enemy and the game will count it as if you had touched the enemy and not jumped on and hit it.
4. Same with some platforms. Sometimes you jump on a platform just to find yourself flying through it.



Sometimes this game can be really challenging - and that I appreciate. But if you want hardcore, "Crash Bandicoot N-Sane Trilogy" is coming out in Steam in the middle of 2018, why would you want to play "Castle of Illusion" to be challenged? It is a nice relaxing game, but I was expecting more of it. And no Mickey.

40443998.review:
I'll recommend this game because it's pretty good, but do NOT buy it for $15. That is too much to ask for a game this short. On sale for $5 or less definitely consider getting it.

I finished the game in under 2 hours. Granted I did not go back to get every collectable, but that's not really something I'm into. You could probably add another 2 hours just re-visiting the levels and exploring them further, but even still it's a very short and simple game. It's only 5 worlds, each with 2 levels and a boss. Graphically it's pretty great and some of the levels like the desert one are really creative and have some interesting effects like when you waddle through jello or swim in tea. All around it's nice to look at and fun to explore. There just doesn't seem to be a lot of meat to the game to keep you coming back to it unless you're a hardcore Disney fan who absolutely loves Mickey. Great game for kids especially, but definitely wait for a sale.

39956506.review:
I’m going to be honest… I was a Nintendo kid, so when I picked this up I kinda thought it was The Magical Quest. That’s the one where Mickey gets costumes with special powers, like a firefighter or Carnac the Magnificent. Castle of Illusion obviously isn’t that, it’s a remake of a classic SEGA cart and for my part I was still willing to give it a shot. I have no nostalgia for a game I never played, so you can believe me when I say this one holds up just fine on its own. Despite a few polish concerns Castle of Illusion does a lot with its limited mechanics and scope, making up for them with wonderfully creative levels.

The ubiquitous mouse is out on a picnic with his gal Minnie when the dastardly witch Mizrabel snatches her away for a dark ritual. Mickey gives chase back to the crone’s castle, a twisted edifice filled with portals to illusory worlds. There’s no way up to the tower where Minnie is held, but if Mickey can collect seven rainbow gems from the castle they’ll form a magical bridge he can cross. Grabbing them is no mean feat though, for each is held by one of Mizrabel’s masters of illusion who hold sway in their dreamlike domains.

Mickey’s definitely taking a few pages out of Mario’s book here, and not just from the lost sweetheart chapter. From the free 3D roaming of the castle to the fantasic pocket worlds to the scavenger list of magic gems to collect, Castle of Illusion hearkens heavily back to Mario 64 in structure and style. There are five rooms in the castle that lead to different worlds, each locked until you find the rainbow gem and a prescribed number of diamonds in the previous world. Within each world you’ll face a mix of 2D and 3D platforming, bouncing off enemies and hopping from ledge to ledge in search of gems and the exit. You’ll have two pure platforming levels per world, capped off by some kind of boss to topple.

What makes Castle of Illusion special is how each realm is used to pose new challenges. The initial forest world has a great deal of verticality to explore by bouncing off of bats and insects, while the toy world features side areas themed around different toy sets. By far my favorite world is the library, which is filled with giant books that both shove you around and serve as makeshift platforms. There are tons of secrets to turn up here, even before you find adjoining passages to a candyland of flowing cream and floating cookies. Beyond the diamonds there are health and extra life pickups to find, as well as some well-hidden collectibles like castle statues, playing cards, and chili peppers which all unlock certain features back in the castle proper.

The bosses in particular stand out as high points, as they have very clear and creative patterns that still require decent reflexes to overcome. Most of the enemies and even the platforming aren’t that challenging until the final level or so, which could be a turn-off to hardcore platforming enthusiasts. The only other knock I have against Castle of Illusion is in some lacking aspects of the polish. Mid-budget platformers and remakes in general seem to end up feeling a bit cheaper than they should, and here it’s due to some thin sound effect design, a lack of feedback for combat, and some floaty movement. Really nothing you do has much weight to it, and while the cartoonish antics don’t demand it the overall game feel is worse for not having it as a consideration.

I’ll not knock the game’s graphics, though. Castle of Illusion perfectly channels Mickey and his grimmer adventures, tempering the darkness with adorable enemies pulled right from classic films. Mickey himself looks fantastic, and really pops against the colorful backgrounds and art. Between that and the excellent narrator reading along with the story, you’ll find a strong offering for the aesthetically-minded. And for everyone else, there are a couple hours of quality platforming to partake of. It won’t set the world on fire but Castle of Illusion delivers where it counts, giving our friend Mickey fanciful worlds to run and jump and explore in.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

39933471.review: This game has a charming simplicity and level of polish that takes me back to the SNES platforming days (Mickey Mouse's Magical Quest).  For as few mechanics as Mickey has, they are used very creatively throughout this short game.  There are plenty of secrets that are tucked away in each level that make you want to revisit them just to collect everything.  I originally played this on my Amazon Kindle, getting up to the last boss but haven't beaten them yet due to the wonky controls, at least that's my excuse for now.  But I fully intend on taking the game to completion on Steam because I am having that much fun replaying it my second time around.

39862128.review:
A short, but good, platformer starring Mickey Mouse. The graphics and stylings work well as well as the vocals, but for a game with a strong "collect them all" mentality, it has a lot of one-way doors and other traps to prevent you from getting everything in a straight forward manner.

Also the last boss has an intro cutscene that lasts too long each time you have to fight her.

39851985.review:
[h1] Микки вернулся, эй![/h1]

На самом деле, это случилось давно, и  у всего этого довольно таки печальная история, знаете-ли.  Сега купила студию в Австралии, и те должны были сделать римейк Golden Axe. Всё было готово, но тут подвернулся шанс от Диснея, и они релизнули эту игру куда-только можно. Но Иллюзорная серия Микки Мауса довольно таки большая и старая, и если вам интересно узнать о них подробнее, то рекомендую посмотреть 35 выпуск Игрового Чуланчика, почерпнете много нового.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h_zUBOmLOEU&t=1232s
И после её релиза эту студию закрыли, хотя со своей задачей они справились хорошо. [spoiler] Сега пидорасы[/spoiler]

Игра мне эта ну ооочень понравилась, несмотря на то, что были дикие просадки фпс. Да, мой комп деревянный, но тут не слишком много чему тормозить на самом деле, я удивлен что нет даже 30 фпс. Возможно это индивидуально, не буду заострять на этом внимании. Это римейк первого Замка Иллюзии с Микки Маусом. Но римейк очень хороший. Перенесли в 3д плоскость довольно таки плавно и очень красиво. Локации прям живые и обьемные во всех смыслах. Есть чувство сказочности. Это классический, я бы даже матюкнулся, ортодоксальный платформер. Управление простое и отличное.  Мы прыгаем на врагов и иногда кидаемся в них снарядиками.  Уровни линейны и коротки, но насыщенны событиями и красочны сами по себе. Добавили диалоги и реплики персонажами, отдельное спасибо рассказчику, он вносит ощущение настоящей доброй и просто сказки времен моего детства) Ну и юморок даже есть хороший, плюсую. Без этих современных тупорылых мемов, если вы  понимаете, о чём  я.  Тут на уровнях и от камней в стиле Индианы Джонса нужно будет убегать, и по платформочкам прыгать разрушаемым, и в шляпе фокусника побывать, и в чашке чая поплавать пару раз) Тут на самом деле очень много оригинальных и красивых моментов.  Сама игра не очень сложная, проблемы возникнут разве что у маленьких детей, но для них это будет хороший челендж, а для взрослого лба вроде меня просто приятная прогулка по хорошей игре) Есть так же довольно хорошие боссы.  У них патерны не очень сложные, но довольно таки интересные и лучше, чем в оригинале 90-ого года например. 

Сам римейк вышел годным.  Уровни стали длиннее и глубже, добавили новые елементы.  Боссы получили больше патернов, и проверок на реакцию тут очень много по сравнению с оригиналом.  Есть открываемы контент, ввиде костюмчиков и концеп-артов стилизованных под статуи и портреты. Иии...всё.  Итак, я хочу указать на парочку минусов с этого момента. Они не существенны, но вы должны это знать.

[u]Незначительные минусы[/u]
- Нет ни русских субтитров, ни озвучки. Они есть, в гайдах на них есть ссылки, но я бы рекомендовал ставить только текст. Голос рассказчика уж больно хорош оригинальный, если вы можете оценить анлгийские диалоги. Это говорит о наплевательском отношении Сеги к русскоязычному сегменту Стима.
-  Очень низкая реиграбельность. Да, в неё вроде вложили попытку перепроходить много раз, но самое главное добавить забыли. Открываемый контент в виде "игра-в-игре". Есть целых 4(!) стареньких игрушки из Иллюзорной серии. Почему нельзя было спрятать их хорошо в игре, что бы люди могли и к ретро-играм этой серии приобщится? Мне лично не ясно. [spoiler] Сега и её руководство жадные и ленивые гандоны[/spoiler]
- Игра очень коротенькая. 3 часа максимум  в среднем.  И несмотря на то, что это хороший римейк, этого очень мало для той цены в Стиме, что есть сейчас. Будь в ней еще 4 классические игры Иллюзорной серии - тогда я бы простил её всё это.
- Есть небольшие глюки и баги. Так, например однажды босс застыл на месте и никак на меня не реагировал.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1291768436

[u]Итог[/u]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1126176713
Если вам нравится Дисней,в частности Микки Маус, его дух и атмосфера, и вы хотите купить легкий но интересный платформер для себя и для детей, то это отличный вариант. Но только если покупать её по скидке, в ней слишком мало контента по меркам 2013 года на самом деле.  Это хорошая  игра, и хотелось бы видеть такие игры в Стиме почаще.  Один раз её пройти можно, она этого заслуживает.

Ok so this game I have owned on the saga master system and the saga mega drive when i was a kid. i have seen a few videos of this version I also got a demo version for the PS3 and i hated the way it looked and yes it looked cleaner and has a lot more in depth 3D graphics. but I did not want to own this full version at all.
Any way my husbamd found me this on sale and bought it as a gift. i have played the first door where you need 15 gems to unlock it.
I am pleasently supprised by how much i actually enjoy this game. i would go with plugging in a xbox One controller to play this (ps4 controller did not work)
the game has had some updates and gameplay updates to move it in current times. i miss the sound that the mega drive version used to make when mickey hit his head on any surface.
but now it also has a narrator so you no longer need to read lots of text to understand what happened in the story which means getting into the actual game is much easier.
I am so glad that i have given it another chance because playing the levels for the times now rather than trying to compare it to the earlier versions it works.
the game play is still simple and basically your enimies still act the same way as they used to.
i also like the boss after the first door. i remeber the boss and trying to complete him the noises when the nuts fell used to make me turn the sound off the tv.
but now with the new sounds added it is much more pleasing to listen to and rather than a little squeak when mickey get hits he now says words which gives it more of a mickey feel which was needed.
If you ever played this as a child see how you feel about this game now it has been updated and brought into this gaming era.

This game does have an actual replay value which many platformer games doesn't have. That's how much I liked this game. In just one playtrough I was managing to beat the game in roughly 1.5 hours. For a game that was released in 2013 the graphics are stunning. If you love Platformer games, this one right here is definately worth buying for the full price. 
You are playing as Mickey Mouse himself who is suppose to beat all kinds of bosses and enemies by jumping on them or using apples and spheres as projectiles. You will get to go trough very cool and retro designed levels. Super Mickey Brother's are back at it again!
The Mickey Mouse animitation are on point.
After each boss has been defeated, you will recieve a gemstone. Once all seven gems have been collected, you can build yourself a rainbow bridge leading up to the castle tower, in which you'll gets to fight Mizrabel. She is the last boss of the game and the witch that captured Mimmi Mouse because she wants to drain her youth and power. 
It's one of the best SEGA games I have ever played.

39017379.review:
Castle of Illusion is a great game. 
I would even say it's one of the best platformers I've played this year.

You play as Mickey who has to save his beloved Minnie from an evil witch, and collect as many gems and other special items along the way. There are also special unlockable costumes for Mickey to be found as well. 

The aesthetics are gorgeous, leaving us with a very colorful game. The music fits the mood very well. The narrator, as well as the voice actor for other characters, do a great job at their respective roles. The cutscenes are played out in a lovely 2D hand drawn style, almost like reading a story book. 

And don't let the fact that it's a Mickey Mouse game catch you off guard. Castle of Illusion is in no way a game only kids would enjoy. There's plenty of challenge for all ages, especially if you're trying to 100% clear it.

Overall, it's a must play for any Disney fan, and even if you don't like Disney or Mickey Mouse too much, it's still worth a look.

38976869.review:
Being a remastered version of the 1990 classic with the same name, it does a really great job at being so. 

An exciting mix of old and new, with lots of specific level design copied outright, but expanded on every axis – the action mostly being 2D. Many locations is however situated in an 3D enviromen. Castle of Illusion can sometimes really remind me of other games from the same era, but its looks and personality easily earn its Disney logo. It’s stylish, it moves well, and every stage is packed with character and gimmicks to uncover and enjoy. 

Mickeys movement can sometimes be a slippery, and sadly doesn´t keep up with some of the intense platforming. But other than that, the game is extremely easy, and it made me kind of annoyed. Especially the boss in each world, being so easy that I wondered why iI even spent my time. And the final boss with the villain Mizrabel, was unforgivable. I beat her after one try, and the credits rolled. I get that the demographic is disney-fans, possibly a young audience. But since it goes as an retrospective, I seriously would have wished for more of a challenge. 

Ignoring some minor details, this game brings alot new to the table, and is a fun modern reworking of the original game. A friendly platformer, even though I would love some harder difficulty, since I adored the original game. 

I really recomend picking it up, just be aware of the shadow.

38778992.review: Volviendo a nuestra infancia, Castle of Illusion nos sumerge en el mundo Disney de la mano de Mickey Mouse y su querida Minnie. Siguiendo el desarrollo habitual de los cuentos de la época, la felicidad de ambos se ve interrumpida por un villano, la malvada bruja. Envidiosa de Minnie, decide raptarla con el fin de despojarle de su belleza. Nuestro cometido no es otro que encarnar a Mickey para conseguir nuestro propio final feliz. Un maravilloso remake del juego original de 1990. Doblaje con las voces originales. Contamos con seis niveles, cada uno de ellos se desarrolla en un entorno distinto conforme vamos avanzando en la historia. La alta calidad de los escenarios posibilita que podamos zambullirnos completamente en este universo de fantasía rodeados de soldaditos de plomo, fichas de ajedrez, caramelos, rosquillas, perlas de chocolate y un largo etcétera.

38663330.review:
Как-то залипал в древнюю платформу от сеги и там игры с героями Диснея не проходили мимо. Конкретно с Микки Маусом запомнилось две - MickeyMania и World of Illusion в кооперативе с Дональдом Даком. Так вот эта игра хоть и красочная, но всё равно не такая интересная и удивляющая, как те две уже древние игры... Попробуйте сами и убедитесь в разительном отличии. Мелодии в старых сеговских играх просто завораживают, а здесь даже не запоминаются. Не понимаю, где утеряли эту магию. Вроде и красиво всё, но почему-то не цепляет. Всё как-то медлительно и без души... Как и переиздание Duck Tales. Налицо тренд - выкинуть продукт и по быстрому собрать кассу, хотя потом спустя года и вспоминать не хочется эту сырость...

И поэтому обидно конкретно. Периодически игра ещё страдает от нехватки оптимизации. Поддержки также уже давно нет, несмотря на бурные обсуждения. Даже того сеговского кооператива нет. Я постоянно спрашивал себя - "Ну почему не переиздали World of Illusion???" Как же здесь всё уныло после той игры. Столько было ярких диснеевских играх. И сейчас их уже выпускают без ремастера... В 2017-м году... Даа. Поэтому неуд за такую халтуру. Но может кому-то и зайдёт, но мне показалось всё дико скучно и медленно. Кадры периодически скачут от 30 до 60  и обратно без видимых причин.

Не рекомендую из-за отсутствия русского перевода...

Castle of Illusion это на самом деле хороший ремастеринг знаменитого одноименного сеговского платформера. По сюжету злая ведьма украла Минни Маус и нам что бы спасти её, управляя Микки Маусом, необходимо пройти шесть уровней, отмудохать шесть боссов (хотя на самом деле пять) и в конце отлупить Ведьму. 
	Красочная, сочная игра сама по себе доставляет удовольствие, но если вы захотите пройти игру всюду и поперёк, что бы собрать все ачивки, да и это все делается без особого напряга, разве что кроме нескольких отдельных моментов, например, поиск остатков бриллиантов в библиотеке или нежданчики в замке. Не знаю как вам, а вот меня в конце бой с ведьмой несколько поднапрёг. Обнаружил приятную вещь - если ваши жизни подходят к концу, а эта злая старуха никак не хочет проигрывать, то стоит нажать рестарт уровня и все ваши жизни вернуться в том количестве, с котором вы вошли в комнату на бой к боссу.

37681569.review:
[h1]Review zu Castle of Illusion[/h1]

Castle of Illusion ist ein hervorragender kleiner Platformer, welcher zwar in einer geringen Anzahl an Stunden des Spielens komplett mit allen Errungenschaften gemeistert werden kann und dennoch so viel neues in das Platformergenre hinein wirft. Oder sollte ich eher sagen "geworfen hat"? Schließlich ist das Spiel eigentlich nur ein Remake des Castle of Illusion aus den 90ern. Doch damals war dieses Spiel - natürlich - in der zweiten Dimensionsansicht spielbar. Im Remake hingegen wird ab und zu zwischen 2D und 3D gewechselt und dies sogar gekonnt! Es gibt viele Platformer die dies entweder im falschen Zeitpunkt machen, oder an Stellen in denen es eigentlich überhaupt nicht notwenig gewesen wäre.
Die Geschichte des Spiels ist eigentlich schnell erklärt und ist halt nun mal an Super Mario´s Konzept mit der verschwundenen Maid angelehnt. Davon kann man halten was man möchte, doch wie diese Geschichte erzählt worden ist, ist die Simplistik der Geschichte wirklich verzeihbar. Der Sprecher, welcher die Geschichte mit seiner großartigen Stimme vertont schafft mitsamt den Soundtrack eine Atmosphäre wie kein zweites Spiel!
Ursprünglich wurde Castle of Illusion sogar aufgrund der Lizenz kurzzeitig von Steam entfernt. Da ich davon Wind bekommen habe und das Spiel damals für 1,50€ wohl zum letzten Mal kaufen könnte, habe ich nicht lange gefackelt und sofort zugeschlagen. Nun, wie wir hier selbst an der Rezension sehen. Das Spiel ist wieder verfügbar. Die Gründe für das Widerkehren sind mir schleierhaft, aber dennoch bin ich froh, dass das Problem mit den Lizenzen wohl irgendwie geregelt wurde und so der Spieler in den Genuss dieses herrlichen Platformers kommen kann.

Kommen wir für die Schnellen unter uns einfach mal zur Pro-Contra-Liste:

[u][b]Pro:[/b][/u]

+ Soundtrack
+ Geschichtenerzähler
+ gutes Leveldesign
+ raffinierte Ideen
+ faszinierende Bosse
+ gekonntes Ändern der zweiten und dritten Dimension während des Spielens
+ abwechslungsreiche Orte
+ diverse Gegner

[u][b]Contra:[/b][/u]

- Für Kinder wohl zu schwer angehoben, deshalb Eltern: Lasst dieses Spiel nicht eure Kinder spielen! Sie könnten aufgrund des Schwierigkeitsgrades frustriert werden!

[u][b]Prontra:[/b][/u]

+- Lediglich zwei Möglichkeiten um zu Kämpfen: Äpfel werfen und auf die Gegner draufspringen. Ist zwar definitiv genug, dass einem nicht langweilig wird, aber ich hätte mir mehr gewünscht. Eine Stampfattacke wäre eine Möglichkeit gewesen.

Ich habe für alle Errungenschaften und allen einsammelbaren Gegenständen ca. 7 Stunden gebraucht. Eine aktzeptable Zeit für ein kleines Platformerabenteuer. Jedoch empfehle ich das Spiel in einem Sale zu kaufen. 14,99€ wären mir persönlich zu viel für eine eher kurze Einzelspielererfahrung.

Ich danke fürs Lesen und wünsche sehr viel Spaß beim Spielen! ;-)

http://store.steampowered.com/app/227600/Castle_of_Illusion/

37677318.review: Замечательная игра, стоящая своих денег. Не сложная, не долгая, но какая яркая, красочная, мелодичная, интересная, привносящая нотки детства, и переносящая нас во времена  приставок Dendy и Sega. Прошёл  игру с удовольствием, и захотелось добиться всех достижений, поиграть в неё ещё, насладиться её музыкой и атмосферой. Хотелось бы побольше подобных игр на ПК. Спасибо разработчикам и авторам перевода, благодаря которым игра стала шедевром! Данную игра можно советовать всем любителям платформеров и любителям игр от приставок Dendy и Sega. A very nice game for kids aged 4-10 years, based on the characters of Walt Disney. With a little dexterity, the game can be completed by anyone.
PRO:

MINUS
- maximum 60 FPS

36432756.review:
Castle of Illusion is a reimagining of the Sega Genesis game of the same name, and is such a complete overhaul that it feels entirely new. You play as Mickey Mouse on a quest to save his girlfriend, Minnie, from the cluches of Misrabel the Witch in her Castle of Illusion. Although the entire game takes place in this castle, the "illusion" aspect allows for a lot of variety in the levels, including a forest level, a candy-themed level, a level where Mickey is the size of an actual mouse, and more.

The platforming is tight, and there are even short 3D sections to break up the action which flow so well with the 2D areas that it feels like a natural addition. I'm also happy to say that the absurdly difficult platforming section found in the second area of the first level is now entirely optional, so there's no need for alarm if you fall. Speaking of which, since this is based on a game from the 90's, it can be deceptively difficult in its later half which might put off some players, but stick with it and you can get past it.

All in all, it's a fantastic remake and also a wonderful game in its own right. It's easily one of Disney's best games that isn't called Kingdom Hearts.

Mario 64 style level select paired with Trine-looking 2D platformer paired with a healthy dose of "collect all the things" and a bit of Disney magic makes for a great time!

36335910.review:
[h1] Castle of Illusion is a brief, delightful platformer that made me smile.[/h1]

This is the perfect game for anyone, any age. The story is simple. You get to play as Mickey Mouse jumping around to save Minnie. It's short enough to play in a couple of sittings. The difficulty is medium I'd say. Don't go in expecting a challenge, but don't expect the game to hold your hand either. I wish the game was a little longer though. (Spoiler) You have to collect 7 gems to complete the rainbow bridge. I took this to mean there are 7 "worlds" to play. This isn't the case. The first half of worlds are 1 gem per world, but the last half are 2 gems per world. So, the back half of the game felt rushed to me. I wanted more levels. However, every level had it's own look and feel to it, the platforming was satisfying, and the whole game just made me feel happy. I'd recommend this to anyone wanting an easy going relaxing game.

There are no jump scares.

36125758.review:
Aunque no he jugado al original, he visto speedrun para poder compararlo a esta versión y tengo que decir que la recreación en 3D de los entornos y las reinvenciones de algunos de los bosses están bastante bien, al fin y al cabo siempre podrían haber hecho un simple port o como mucho mejorar las texturas y tirar de nostalgia para vender.

El juego es difrutable pero dista mucho de estar pulido, y si lo recomiendo es porque disfrutar lo he disfrutado, pero como no todo el mundo tiene que ser tan permisivo como yo, os dejo aquí unas cosillas que podéis tener en cuenta:

Primero, más os vale tener un PC relativamente potente. SEGA optimizó este juego fatal y, para que os hagáis una idea, un PC que puede tirar juegos como Dead Space sin problemas, puede dar unos FPS tan bajos con Castle of Illusion que lo hacen injugable.

Además, Mickey se mueve de forma muy ortopédica, el movimiento no fluye en absoluto ya que Mickey no conserva nada de aceleración en los saltos. En el mismo instante que dejas de moverte horizontalmente en el aire, Mickey se para en seco para moverse solo en eje vertical. Cuesta acostumbrarse, la verdad.

Por último, hay algunas decisiones de diseño que son del siglo pasado y no pintan nada en un juego de esta década. Por ejemplo, cuando sales de una fase apareces siempre al inicio del nexo en vez de delante de la fase que acabas de salir, y si estás repitiendo la fase para los coleccionables te acabas metiendo unos paseos bien aburridos volviendo a donde ya estabas. 

Mi consejo personal es que si queréis jugarlo y estos fallos os parecen irrelevantes, le déis una oportunidad; pero si lo que queréis es jugar a ALGO COMO esto, jugad a los dos primeros Trine que son prácticamente iguales en esencia a Castle of Illusion pero mejores, con más contenido y sin los fallos mencionados. Y si lo que queréis es jugar a un buen juego actual de Mickey, intentad jugar al Epic Mickey (el primero) que le da cien vueltas a este juego.

Espero que os sirva ;)

As a kid, playing this on the SEGA Genesis gave off a magical feeling and ensured it provided a challenge, yet made the game so addictive and left you wanting more as a result. Plus, it's very short and can be finished with half (if not most) Achievements. Amazing title, would reccommend.

34639513.review:
I don't recommend supporting Sega. Even buying their good games supports bad practices.

If you don't care whether you support DRM that may repeatedly force you online for re-validation; or make games that use it eventually cease to work for all legitimate owners; or you only care about this particular piece of software then it's safe to ignore the preamble & "score" of this review. I believe the rest of its contents are fair criticism.

Buying any of Sega's products, even older ones that lack that DRM like this one does, will support the inclusion of said DRM in future products. As someone who does a lot of gaming offline I can't support a company which does that.

You won't even be supporting the developer because Sega apparently shut the studio that made this remake down as soon as it was finished; and Disney more than likely take most of the profit anyway.

If that doesn't bother you, again, feel free to ignore my preamble and "score".
---

This is a decent remake of the classic 2D platformer, with occasional 3D segments thrown in at random, but it has issues with running at a decent framerate. It's very happy to cap itself at 30fps for seemingly no reason. It was initially capped at 30 intentionally, as it was on console, but a patch was supposed to fix it to cap at 60.

It has a slight feeling of being unfinished, or perhaps just overly simplified for children. Many segments are optional challenges in a stage which reward you with a collectible upon completion; but if you fall in a pit that would’ve killed you in a normal stage you merely respawn near their entrance. Some of them are mandatory to attempt but will let you progress immediately upon your first failure so the speedrunning trick is to “die” on purpose.

A lot of these segments look like you were supposed to clear them before progressing in a stage, given the changes that have taken place in the main stage upon your return to it.

You now need a certain amount of collectibles to progress through the game. This was somewhat a factor in the 8-bit versions since I think you could technically miss 2 of the rainbow gems & needed all 7 to unlock the final stage. I’m fairly sure the 16-bit original was entirely linear.

Collectible hunting works more like a Banjo Kazooie kind of platformer here, since there’s hundreds of clear gems to collect, but it’s never hard to find enough gems in levels to carry on. It wouldn’t surprise me if the developers were aiming for a sort of Banjo Kazooie feel since they even brought Grant Kirkhope in to compose the remake’s soundtrack.

The original 16-bit soundtrack is also included as an option but doesn't fit some of the redesigned levels that are far longer than some of these music tracks were intended to play for. The first stage's apple chase is a particular example.

I see no good reason that the 16-bit version couldn't have been included as it was with PS3 pre-orders or at least sold on Sega's crappy emulator hub thing, even if it had to be at a higher price than the other games on it. Sega clearly worked something out with Disney both to make this remake and to release the original on PS3.

I'll at least grant that this remake has far fewer issues than Capcom/Wayforward's Ducktales Remastered does on pretty much every format. I've never had this remake crash on me but I've had Ducktales Remastered crash a bunch of times on PS3 & I hear the PC port is even less stable.

If you're looking for a retro Disney-platformer remaster then you might want to consider this game during a sale.

33658238.review:
Tras un período de tiempo en el que estuvo retirado por temas de licencias, Castle of Illusion vuelve a estar disponible en la tienda Steam :)

Remake increíblemente fiel del clásico juego de Sega Genesis (aquí más conocida como Mega Drive). Yo lo jugué en Master System 2 y aunque es menos fiel a esta versión que a la de Megadrive, me ha recordado muchísimo al juego que disfruté en mi infancia: los escenarios, enemigos, la música... este juego es un claro ejemplo de como debe ser un remake. 

Vayamos por partes:

[h1]HISTORIA:[/h1]

Controlamos a Mickey Mouse en una aventura en la que nuestro objetivo es salvar a Minnie de las garras de una malvada bruja, que planea robar la belleza de la ratoncita. Poco más que añadir en este apartado. El juego es bastante infantil pero encantará a los más nostálgicos que como yo lo jugaron hace más de 20 años en Mega Drive, Master System, Game Gear o Sega Saturn.

[h1]GRÁFICOS:[/h1]

Estéticamente es muy bonito, tanto los escenarios como los personajes que aparecen están muy bien diseñados y son muy fieles a lo que pudimos ver hace más de 20 años en el juego original de Mega Drive. Los niveles son muy variados y están llenos de detalles. La mayor parte del tiempo jugaremos en una vista 2.5D al más puro estilo de los plataformas clásicos pero con gráficos actuales, aunque combinamos partes en las que controlamos a Mickey con total libertad de movimientos en 3D.

[h1]SONIDO:[/h1]

Excelente también en este apartado. Tanto los efectos de sonido, como la banda sonora son sobresalientes. Uno de los detalles que más me ha gustado es que nos da la posibilidad de elegir entre los temas clásicos o los nuevos (por supuesto y tratándose de un nostálgico como es mi caso lo he jugado con los clásicos). El juego no está doblado, pero las voces en inglés del narrador, la de Mickey y los demás personajes son excelentes. Con la traducción es más que suficiente aunque quizá se hubiese agradecido un doblaje para los más pequeños.

[h1]CONTROL:[/h1]

El control responde bastante bien tanto con teclado como con mando, aunque es recomendable el uso de mando Yo lo jugué con el de XBOX 360 y 0 problemas, todo perfecto. El mecanismo es bastante simple, casi todo el tiempo tenemos que ir saltando de un sitio a otro, sorteando obstáculos y evitando enemigos, completar una serie de puzzles... muy al estilo de los plataformas clásicos.

Resumiendo, os dejo con mi lista de pros y contras:

[h1]PROS:[/h1]

- 100% fiel al clásico original

- Un plataformas muy entretenido

- Poder controlar a Mickey

- Recomendable tanto como para los más nostáligicos como para los pequeños de la casa

- Poder elegir entre las músicas clásicas o las nuevas versiones

- Gráficamente es muy bonito y vistoso

- Las imágenes de las cinemáticas

- Funciona perfectamente en equipos y sistemas operativos actuales

- Niveles llenos de detalles

- Está perfectamente traducido al español

- Posibilidad de conseguir trajes exclusivos

- Es rejugable, sobre todo para conseguir logros que nos hayamos dejado o buscar diamantes mágicos ocultos

- Tiene sistema de guardado de la partida en la nube Steam Cloud

- Se suele encontrar a muy buen precio en épocas de ofertas de Steam

- Tiene logros Steam


[h1]CONTRAS:[/h1]

- Se hace un poco corto, no he necesitado ni 7h para conseguir prácticamente el 100% de los logros

- Muy sencillo, no supondrá un reto demasiado complicado

- Puede resultar muy infantil a los que no vengan por nostalgia

- No está doblado al español

- No tiene cromos Steam


[h1]CONCLUSIÓN:[/h1] 

Muy recomendable para nostáligicos del clásico y para los peques de la casa. Remake muy fiel. Recomendable esperar a época de ofertas para hacerse con él a buen precio.


Si mi análisis te ha gustado o te ha servido de ayuda, agradecería que dejaras un voto positivo para que pueda llegar a más gente. ¡Gracias por leerme!

33103610.review:
Castle of Illusion is a great platformer game with Mickey Mouse as it's main character. You have to collect the rainbow gems in order to save Minnie from an evil witch and for doing so, you need to go through many worlds and kill their bosses to collect them.

The game soundtrack is composed by the awesome Grant Kirkhope, the same pesron that did the OST for Banjo-Kazooie, Banjo-Tooie, Donkey Kong 64, Yooka-Laylee, etc... so well, obviously the music is fantastic! The graphics are using a lovely Disney style for them. As for the story, it was a little on the basic Disney side... but it wasn't bad at all.

As for the gameplay, well it's good, there's just a few issues. The platforming is nice and the levels are interesting, but there's a few bad design ideas. First of all, in a game where you have gather collectibles, there shouldn't be parts where you are forced into a further part of the level and unable to go back. It makes having to restart the game really often when you want to gather all the gems on a certain level and it's truly annoying.

Then there's the controls... I've played with a keyboard, I know the game is meant for controller, but still... In a certain level where you have to jump from cookies and I have no clue if this happens with a controller too, but it's just so wonky! I've had to retry this level multiple times because somehow, whenever I got close to the border of those cookies, I would try and jump and get stuck in an invisible wall as if it was meant to make it impossible to fall by jumping from cookie to cookie (they're over a deadly milkshake pool). But well, sometimes the barrier would work and sometimes it wouldn't, so if you weren't ready for it to work this time or whatever, you pretty much jump to your death every time.

Then there's the feeling the last parts were rushed... The progression felt nice up to the last world or two, which felt really rushed to be honest. That and many unfair mechanics in the game... and some parts where you'd have to jump way down only to end up on a monster and die (just why?).

Lastly, I don't think game with optional speedrun modes should have waiting included in their timing. I figured this the hard way when I tried to speed through the levels to find out that I had to wait for ropes to swing to my location no matter how fast I had gotten there...

Other than that, the game is great and I suppose it will be easy to jump over it's flaws. If you're a perfectionist or an achievement hunter, the game should take you a good six hours to find all the collectibles and unlock everything, as well as finishing the game.

But sadly, if you're just going through the game like a normal person and doing the strict minimum, I don't think the game would last much longer than 1 H... maybe 2H... It's mostly time consuming to do all the speedrun mode and collect everything, but the levels themselves are really short!

32967492.review:
O jogo original do Mega Drive era excelente e esse remake pegou tudo o que era bom e melhorou. Pra quem vê hoje o Mickey se perdendo naquele "dia legal" chato feito pra concorrer com os Backyardigans, dá gosto poder jogar de novo uma coisa da Disney, com o Mickey, que mesmo sendo voltado pro público infantil consegue encher os olhos da turma adulta. 

O negócio tem, bem, o jeito da Disney de fazer as coisas. Os gráficos não são apenas bonitos, eles têm o estilo artístico da companhia. Mesmo pra música, que já era ótima na época (e você ainda pode escolher a trilha original nas opções). A jogabilidade remete ao original com muitas melhoras - pular em fantasmas, fugir da maçã, esperar a água baixar pra avançar, ser sugado por correntes de água subterrâneas, tá tudo lá, só que mais bem trabalhado. As lutas dos bosses ficaram mais complexas, eles imitam as mecânicas antigas e começam a usar umas novas... enfim, um remake muito responsa.

Um ponto negativo é só não poder pular as cutscenes, que é bem chato. Antes dum boss tem uma cutscene, aí você morre, tem que repetir a cutscene pra tentar a luta de novo.

No fim, compre se você gostou do original do Mega, se você gosta de um plataformer com jogabilidade inteligente, ou se você tem uns moleques que deviam dar um tempo do Minecraft. 

Pra mim, este remake está no nível do Strider.

31756129.review:
Castle of Illusion è un remake dell'omonimo gioco platform per Sega Mega Drive.

Vestiremo OVVIAMENTE i panni di Topolino (Mickey Mouse) che combatterà e si farà strada per salvare la sua amata.

Un'atmosfera ben riuscita, capace di rapire il giocatore.

Gameplay semplice ed  intuitivo anche se ho trovato la risposta del gioco sulla pressione dei tasti (combinazioni) non impeccabile e repentina come avrei voluto.

Lo ho trovato troppo semplice ed ECCESSIVAMENTE, INDECENTEMENTE, FOTTUTAMENTE BREVE. Un fattore che fa venire non pochi dubbi sul suo possibile acquisto, visto il prezzo base di Steam; difatti basteranno all'incirca due ore per completarlo e scordarvi di esso.

Onestamente, è un gioco che consiglierei se fosse appartenuto ad una fascia di prezzo più bassa, perché a mio avviso 13 Euro non li vale, almeno che non siate REALMENTE e MALEDETTAMENTE amanti del genere e dell'universo Walt Disney.

Voto Finale 7/10

Tuttavia, mi trovo a sconsigliarlo per i motivi citati sopra.

31744670.review:
La nostalgie fait vendre, mais elle fait mouche; Ce remake bien que très différent a vivre que l'original m'a replongé dans une époque d'insouciance, et rien que pour cela, je suis conquis. Il en était de même pour un autre disney like : Duck Tales.

A l'instar des licences modernes, là nous avons un jeu plutôt facile à la durée de vie très légère. Les collectibles ne sont pas légion mais prolongent l'expérience de jeu quelques peu. Outre la féérie du jeu pour les plus jeunes, les plus agés y chercherons naturellement leurs souvenirs d'antan. Je ne suis pas sur que ce jeu puisse se destiner à un nouveau public majeur sauf si l'interêt est de découvrir un jeu qu'ils auraient pu rater dans le passé avec regret.

Musicalement et graphiquement, tout transpire du disney et j'ai vraiment l'impression de retrouver une partie du game play des jeux 16 bits à la Roi Lion, Aladdin. La 3d nous rappele l'évolution de ces dernières années et n'est pas excessivement employée à la sauce Crash Bandicoot, pour que le joueur y garde ses repères.

La magie opère pour moi, nourri à la sauce dorothée et a l'age d'or des 8 et 16 bits, qu'en sera il pour vous ?

31690269.review:
DISCLAIMER: Played on a Mac.

Before I say anything else, I had heard this was a remake, but I've never played the original.  However, this game is really well-designed overall.  The graphics were smooth, the loading times were miniscle (on 8 GB RAM), and the music was quite appropriate for the stages.  The game controls fairly well on a Steam controller; it's not high-precision like Super Meat Boy, but it gets the job done and there aren't any glaring issues.


Castle of Illusion is a sort of 2.5D Platformer with most of the game in 2D, though there are 3D segments and the game does a good job meshing them together.


Should you buy it?  That depends.  If you're a hardcore platformer, you won't find much challenge here, though there's enough going on to keep you engaged and some of the collectibles are cleverly hidden (nothing obtuse, though).


If you're looking for an enjoyable casual platformer to unwind with, this is a good one to get.  However, it's pretty short with only ten stages not counting boss fights and the hub world.  I recommend waiting until it's on sale to get the most bang for your buck.

31116492.review:
A game of Micky rescuing his beloved, Minnie. who is taken by the evil witch, Mizrabel.
This kind of story is familiar and well known if you have seen these Disney cartoons during childhood.

There are five worlds, and each has three stages with the last one being a stage boss fight. Plus the final confrontation with Mizrabel. So, the whole is not so long. playtime to finish is within three, more or less than an hour, without trying to grab all collectibles. Despite its shortness. every world is quite well designed no matter the foreground and the background, with the fantastic orchestra music playing.

As a platform game, it is mild, but because of its variety of design and settings, you won't feel much tedious, only becoming a bit difficult and challenging after entering the fourth world. Beware when Micky jumps and lands. Though the control is not complicated with basic movements, jumping and throwing consumable weapons, still it is better to use controllers to play. if not  supported, you can have some app like Joytokey to make your controller available.

In short, the whole game is enjoyable and relaxing. Playing as Micky, hearing Micky's and Minnie's hilarious voice and Mizrabel's witchlike evilish laughing, definitely recommend it.

30958006.review:
通关撒花：梦幻城堡，世嘉发行的一款以米老鼠为主角的横版动作闯关游戏，之前下架了一段时间，据说是因为版权到期，不过现在看来可能是问题解决了。洋溢着浓郁童话气息的画面，萌萌哒的米奇与米妮，对某些玩家来说，代表着一份童年美好的回忆。

虽然看起来像是一款低龄向的游戏，不过本作的操作难度并不低，推荐使用手柄。游戏里可收集的物品有钻石、代表着生命数的金色米老鼠头像、能回复血量的金色星星、可用于投掷攻击的苹果等道具，一边过关一边捡捡捡什么的最开心了。

游戏的难度主要体现在对玩家背版能力的要求上，玩家每次失误都会消耗生命值，生命值归零以后开始消耗生命数量，当生命数量也归零以后本关会重新开始，如果不能很好的记住一些关键的机关和敌人位置，就意味着大量的重复过关，久而久之会失去耐心。

游戏共6大关，前面5大关玩家需要集齐7颗巨大钻石，来开启通往最后一大关的彩虹桥，与终极BOSS决战，夺回心爱的米妮。非常喜欢游戏的关卡场景，魔法森林——水下世界——玩具屋——糖果城堡等等，最爱糖果城堡，没有之一，看到的时候心都萌化啦。

非常有创意的场景设计，很多细节都让菲菲感到惊叹，哇还可以这样！满满的童话元素，让人好像回到了童年，收集——跑酷——BOSS战的结合方式也很具有游戏性，唯一遗憾的就是流程不是很长，通关以后意犹未尽，虽然有些地方难的想摔手柄。

每关关底都有BOSS战，而且越来越难，手残玩家还是要受点苦的。花点时间摸清楚BOSS的攻击和运动规律，然后谨慎走位和攻击，千万不能心急，因为血量实在是拼不过，只能慢慢磨血。BOSS设计的都很有趣，丑萌丑萌的，最喜欢糖果世界的那条龙。

游戏钻石一共800个，不过收集320个就能解锁全部关卡了，前5关需要的钻石数：15——80——160——240——320，如果没收集够就不能解锁后面的关卡，路上看到就尽量拿一下，达标还是很轻松的。菲菲很怕死所以没全收集，咳咳应该说是求稳才对。

游戏一开始，米妮就被巫婆抓走啦，身为米奇的你，要赶快救出爱人。情怀满分，画面满分，创意满分，就是操作稍微难了一点，不介意的话，买买买？米老鼠都出现了，怎么能没有唐老鸭呢？ http://store.steampowered.com/app/237630/

30932400.review:
"Pura magia Disney" -cit. Dr. Sheldon Cooper X-D

Se avete dei figli piccoli e volete fargli un bel regalo, questo gioco è perfetto: trama da fiaba / film Disney classico (Minnie è stata rapita dalla strega Mizrabel e Topolino, ovvero voi, dovete salvarla), gioco semplice e indubbiamente pensato per i giocatori più giovani e/o con scarsa esperienza nel settore (per fare un paragone facilmente comprensibile, i Super Mario sono molto più difficili di questo), regala qualche ora di sano divertimento senza che dobbiate preoccuparvi di sangue / violenza / altra roba del genere.
Per i giocatori più esperti, rimane comunque un ottimo acquisto perché (1) è e rimane un Platform con la P maiuscola, veramente bello da giocare, e (2) i programmatori hanno ben pensato di inserire dentro millemila collezionabili - e raccoglierli tutti, specie senza una guida, è una bella impresa da affrontare. ;-)

Consigliatissimo quindi, ai grandi, ai piccoli, ai... medi, X-D insomma, a tutti. Fortuna vuole che sia "tornato" su Steam dopo essere sparito per molti mesi a causa di problemi legati alla licenza. :-/

30837964.review:
5/10

I played about two thirds of the game and decided I had enough. I don't mind dying and playing the same section again and again, but I do mind that the game punishes me after I died one too many time and reverts to the begining of a level, a good 10 minutes lost (and quite a few checkpoints).

Pros
+ Many aspects of the game are well designed and are highly polished. Graphics, maps (excluding checkpoints / save system), music, narration - are all very professional.
+ Who knew playing as Mickey Mouse can be fun for an adult? It definitely is for large parts of the game.

Cons
- Save system and checkpoints are very poorly done. The biggest issue is the one I described above. In addition, if you exit the game and then start it again, you can't resume from the last checkpoint. You're just dropped in the main hall of the castle and you need to figure out which room you visited last. At least the game remembers which parts were completed.
- Controls. So so bad... specifically platforming on the Z-axis is very difficult with a D-pad. It would have been much easier with classic FPS-like keyboard+mouse controls.
- When you die in boss fights, you have to listen to the same narration again and again, and again. Luckily it's possible to turn off narration, which I temporarily did in boss fights.

If you don't mind seeing later parts of the game (spoiler alert), [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=2FojjJfgWcg#t=2274]this[/url] is the part that I couldn't cross because of the terrible controls. And [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=2FojjJfgWcg#t=2048]this[/url] is how far back the game decided to drop me for failing to pass.

Both links are part of an edited walkthough, so are more compressed compared to how long it actually takes in practice (at least to a player of my modest skills). Just watch the section between these two links and think if it makes any sense to punish the player and force him/her to replay the whole thing instead of just starting again from the last checkpoint.

Considering the poor the level design and frustrating controls are, I just cannot recommend this game, regardless of cost.

25307011.review:
Castle of Illusion- remaster gry przygodowej z SEGA mega drive classics, wydane i stworzony przez SEGĘ. W grze wcielimy się min. w postać Myszki Miki i jego przyjaciół. Z cut-scenki dowiadujemy się, iż zła wiedźma Mizrabel porwała Minnie, dziewczyne Mickiego, gdy ci byli na spacerze, oraz zabrała ją do swojego zamku. Naszym celem jest przedzierać się przez kolejne poziomy, by pokonać Mizrabel i uratować Minnie. Podczas rozgrywki będzie nam toważyszyć lektor, którego głos został idealnie wpasowany w realia gry. Całość uzupełnia wpadający w słuch sountrack.

PLUSY:
-Myszka Miki i jego przyjaciele
-Ładnie odświerzony remaster gry
-Ładna grafika
-Wpadająca w ucho muzyczka podczas gry
-Klimatyczny głos lektora
-Wciągający wątek główny
-Różnorodność etapów, każdy cechują odmienne budowle, stworki
-Osiągnięcia
-Łatwa

MINUSY:
-Krótka (4 godziny powinny wystarczyć, by ukończyć tytuł)

PODSUMUJĄC:
Castle of Illusion to gra, która, choć na krótko, potrafi wciągnąć gracza niezależnie od wieku. Polecam ją każdemu, kto lubi przygodówki, a szczególnie najmłodszym, gdyż wiem z doświadczenia, że gry przygodowe dla dzieci są jak prezent na Gwiazdkę, jak wygrana w Totku. Jeżeli nasz w sobie choć odrobinę z dziecka i dobrze wspominasz czasy dzieciństwa i Myszkę Miki wraz z przyjaciółmi- nie wahaj się sięgnąć po ten tytuł.

OCENA: 9/10

25298631.review:
Castle of Illusion borrows everything from other games:

Castle Hub World from Mario 64
Levels from Klonoa
Bosses and ideas from Crash Bandicoot

This is a great lineage to draw from. The game is meant to appeal to a younger crowd, but everyone who has a love for Disney or gameplay from a gone era should pick this up while there is still time. I wish the controls were more exact and that the art style was more traditional Disney hand drawn, but these are minor gripes. Overall: A short treat I am glad to have had a chance to experience.

25273434.review:
Castle of Ilussion is a good remake from a classic plataformm game of the Sega Genesis/Megadrive where you play as Mickey Mouse who must rescue Minnie from the Evil Witch Mizrabel who keeps her hostage on the castle of ilussion

The thing that I most like about this game is that respect a lot the original source, while still including gameplay elements that couldn't be possible in the genesis/megadrive, like 3d movement.

The controls are a little stiff at the beggining, but once you get the hang out of the game you will be enjoying a lot his mechanics, and ven though this game is a little short and sided to the easy side if you finish it straight away, you can still play some "bonus stage" if you could call it like which are not that hard but still are entertaining and give a bit of a challenge. Besides, even if the challenging aspect of this game is a little dissapointing the game is still a great experience, the graphics are gorgeous, the music is superb, and the story is entertaining and lighthearted so easy to enjoy, also the narrator does a good job on insert you into the story

Sadly this game will dissapear from the store on 2 more days, so if you have some bucks left, buy this game, is an good, albeit short experience which is good enough for 15 bucks

25258797.review:
I have never played the original Genesis game so I'm reviewing this remake on its own merits. Castle of Illusion is a platformer starring everyone’s favorite circular eared rodent, Mickey Mouse. The Evil Queen/Witch from Snow White (The game gives her another name but it’s totally her, right down to her saying she wants to be the fairest of them all.) kidnaps Minnie and tries to pull a page from Grunty’s book by stealing Minnie’s youth and spirit so it’s up to Mickey to venture through the Queen’s castle to save her.

The game is a real solid platformer, and while it’s not hard and pretty forgiving, it’s still got a lot of charm and its fun. The game looks really nice, what with its vibrant locales and cartoony charm. The level design is quite neat and Mickey will have to traverse through a candyland, a library, an ancient underground temple, and the castle itself for example. At the end of each area is a boss fight and these tend to be fun enough, though funny enough I had much more trouble with some of the early game bosses than the later ones. One problem the game has is that it is quite short, it feels like they could have had more levels. You see Mickey has to collect seven gems to get to the Queen’s throne but there’s not an area for all the gems, so you miss out on like two whole areas. Also some of the hit detecting can feel wonky at times, but not enough to be a real problem.

I bought the game recently because Sega is pulling the game from digital distribution at the end of the week. It’s a shame because this game is good, so be sure to grab it here or on Humble Bundle and Bundle Stars while its on sale for like $2 before the game is gone for good.

*Edit* Apparently this game is no longer delisted which is good to see.

24613158.review:
When I was young I played Castle of Illusion on my Sega Game Gear. I loved playing it back then and played through it countless times. This game is a remake of the classic game and it's wonderful. A fantastic omage to the classic game. Reminiscing about my childhood I've been enjoing this game. Leveldesign is very close to the original. Going throw the levels trying to remember all the details of the classic. It's been great. Furthermore there is a storyteller by your side throughout the game. The storyteller does a great job commenting on Mickeys (your) yourney to save Minnie. It's like a book comming alive. The game has replay value. You can unlock some goodies by collecting all items within levels.
I recomend playing this game with a game pad. tried with keyboard, but some sequences were just too difficult beating with a keyboard. After getting my steam controller (every other controller would do a great job as well on this game) it's been a lot easier playing through the storyline. It was a lot of fun playing castle of illusion.
The graphics are well designed, depicturing the comic style of Mickey Mouse. Enjoiable on old graphic cards (mine: GTX 260). Thanks to the developers of this game for paying attention to such detail and the voice actors for giving the characters original voices. It's a great game to enjoy on a free afternoon or evening and a game of value for your game collection.

24604897.review:
Super easy, very reminisant of classic disney, and really nice music and levels.

Pros---The style of the game screams disney, all the backgrounds and characters are super polished, the gameplay is solid, some nice collectables, fun bosses, and the music and sound effects are great.

Cons---Super easy, pretty short, a few glitches, and a very limited amount of abilities.

When all is said and done this game does what it sets out to do. Everything about it is filled to the brim with that Disney feel and polish. This game is both really easy and short, so don't expect to play this for a challenge. This is a nice game to breeze though and enjoy the experience.

Esse remake equilibra bem entre a essência do clássico e autenticidade do Mickey. A qualidade impecável dos elementos gráficos, da ambientação e o rearranjo das músicas fizeram brilhar mais a reimaginação dos elementos da versão clássica. 

Mesmo com curta duração (2hs) e mais alguns bugs, nada disso abalou a ótima jogabilidade e diversão do remake, visto que é um daqueles games que prezam mais na qualidade do que na quantidade, assim como LIMBO e Portal. :)

A dificuldade é baixa, mas com gráfico lindo e jogabilidade fiel a primeira versão, Castle of illusion é uma excelente remasterização.

24205705.review:
Buen juego que respeta en gran medida el trabajo original de Castle of Illusion, el arte del juego es precioso,el lavado de cara para actualizar este clásico de plataformas es tremendo, el apartado gráfico es  muy bueno, y  jugando te sientes como si estuvieses en los años 90.
Me encanta como la cámara en algunas ocasiones se coloca en puntos estratégicos del escenario para darle más espectacularidad.

Ahora vienen los defectos incomprensibles, a pesar de que a mi me ha dado un rendimiento exquisito el juego , sin caídas de frames , ni crasheos , es decir lo que se espera de un juego en buenas condiciones, el tema de la resolucón es incomprensible, el juego te deja elegir resoluciones muy altas que se adaptan a los tiempos que corren, pero cuando inicia el juego te clava automaticamente 720p cosa que desquicia un poco ...

El juego lo compré de oferta por lo que lo recomiendo  si te gustó el clásico, no entiendo las críticas por la duración el original no iba mucho más allá y no creo que hubiese sido positivo que se inventasen el juego pudiendo no agradar a todos o directamente hacerlo mal...

23856186.review:
This reimagining of a Genesis game has beautiful artwork, music and voice acting. In addition to distinct "themes" on different levels, there are level design concepts that make levels less monotonous (e.g. sublevels in area that can turn upside down, switch of perspective). Having said that, it has very annoying controls, and even with the controller it's rather difficult to do precise actions due to loose movement and jumping lag. This is IMHO a very serious problem given the nature of the game. Made worse since the level and boss fight design includes many areas that require precise movements and have instant-death possibilities. I'd say that this combination of control issue and level design issue contributes to much of the "playtime", given that the levels themselves are actually not that long.

I bought this game at 75% off, and even at this price I think there are other games that offers better value for money. Not recommended at all at full price. It's really unfortunate since given the quality of other aspects this could have been a very nice game.

23683078.review:
Un plaform semplice e ben fatto, forse un po' troppo semplice, ma tutto sommato piacevole. Anche se un è un remake del mitico Castle of Illusion del Megadrive, devo ammettere che hanno rispettato tanti dettagli come musiche e livelli pressoché  identici anche se in 3D. Sarebbe stato bello se lo avessero fatto in 2D disegnato, ma ormai il 3D è diventato lo standard per ogni remake anche perché sicuramente più semplice da gestire. Oggi purtroppo non si disegna più come una volta. Per la cronaca quando parlo di 3D intendo che il gioco mantiene un andamento a scorrimento orizzontale, tranne qualche sessione guidata con accesso anche alla profondità. Il 3D è utilizzato per disegnare oggetti e sprites. 

Non ho idea se il gioco sia stato concepito prima per smartphone o pc oppure in contemporanea, ma la giocabilità risulta estremamente semplice e sono portato a pensare che l'apertura a molteplici dispositivi sia la causa della sua semplicità. Non capite? Allora provate a pensare di giocare a Guacamelee su smartphone... per fortuna non è possibile, tutto a vantaggio delle versioni pc e console.

Questa versione comunque per usare una terminologia da bar, "ci sta", peccato sia corta e con poca sfida. Del resto riproponendo la versione del megadrive con una nuova veste grafica non avrebbero potuto allungarla più di tanto. Confermo quanto scritto da altri giocatori che invitano a trovare i bonus nascosti per cercare di renderlo un pochino più longevo. È un gioco per tutti, sia per chi lo giocò nel 1990, sia per chi ha voglia di passare un paio d'ore a saltellare con Topolino che personalmente mi è sempre stato un po' sulle palle, Paperino è decisamente più simpatico, de gustibus.

23310824.review:
[h1]Castle Of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse[/h1] est un jeu remasterisé de la version Sega Megadrive, où vous incarnez donc Mickey qui, lors d'un pique-nique, voit Minnie se faire enlever par la Sorcière Mizrabel (La vilaine de Blanche-Neige si mes souvenirs sont bons). 
Ne pouvant laisser les choses comme ça, notre souris se lance à la rescousse de sa dulcinée ... 

Il faudra retrouver les 7 Cristaux magiques pour obtenir leur pouvoirs et ainsi invoquer l'arc-en-ciel magique servant de pont pour atteindre la Tour de la Malèfique vieille folle...

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=694654705

Le jeu est beaucoup plus simple que dans mes souvenirs, Les jeux 8-16 Bits etant quand même ce qu'ils etaient... 
Il propose aussi d'activer les musiques de l'ancienne version (qui sont tres bien foutues) 

J'ai terminé le jeu en un peu plus de 3h00, en incluant le déblocage des 12 succés ( avec guide-aide pour certains d'entre eux : http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=176111168 ) Un conseil d'ailleurs pour les succès : Ramassez tout ce que vous pouvez ! ne laissez pas trainer 1 diamant, ou vous devrez aller le rechercher plus tard ...  Vous êtes prévenus ! 

Le jeu donne aussi quelques clins d'oeils aux autres oeuvres Disney en y intégrant des costumes rappelant Fantasia ou QuackShot, des enemis rappelant certains personnages qui ne vous sembleront pas inconnus, ... 

Vu le temps de jeu, les 13€ ne sont pas justifiés, vous payez clairement la licence, mais bon, ça pourra occuper vos gamins quelques heures de plus (si on compare avec les tarifs d'une nounou, vous devrez y gagner :p) 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=694654736

23302402.review: I used to play this game on the Sega Genesis. Such a throw back. Wether you played the original or just looking for a fun adventure game, Castle of Illusion is worth a buy. Quite cool to see all the themed stages from the orignal, in HD format.

23196565.review:
Una perla nascosta in fondo all'oceano.
Sono una persona nostalgica e avevo il gioco sul Sega Master System (purtroppo non sul Mega Drive/Genesis) ma cmq non parlo per nostalgia, questo gioco è fantastico.
Non raggiunge minimamente i livelli di vastità e longevità di Rayman Legends, che rimane attualmente il miglior platform disponibile, ma è cmq un'esperienza divertente, rilassante ed estremamente piacevole...non ci sono molti platform in giro oggi per chi ancora li ama e quelli decenti tra questi sono ancora meno.

La grafica è stupenda, pulita, definita, colorata ed azzeccata (pompatela dal pannello nvidia anche con l'AA)...vi riposerete gli occhi per tutto il tempo che giocherete, e non è affatto un punto da sottovalutare, questo.
Il gameplay è semplice quanto efficace...2 tasti e via, ma non vi annoierete mai...e ci vuole bravura di certo a fare un gioco in cui non ci si annoia con 2 tasti, oggi.

Un prodotto che fa della semplicità la sua forza, e qui siamo a livelli estremamente positivi di questa caratteristica...è difficile spiegare quanto semplice ma altrettanto bello sia questo gioco. Se avete avuto una giornata difficile e dovete riprendervi un attimo prima di mettervi a letto è l'ideale...ma se volete una sfida più impegnativa perché vi piacciono i platform...è l'ideale lo stesso. Bella roba!

E io ho sempre preferito Paperino eh! Spero sempre prima o poi che facciano il remake pure del suo, di gioco.

22818356.review:
In "Castle of Illusion" you - Mickey Mouse - save your girlfriend Minnie from the evil and ugly witch Mizrabel. So your goal is as basic as it gets.
You wander through various worlds inside the Castle of Illusion (like a giant library, a magical forest or a toy world) in order to collect seven gems that will make a bridge to the witch and Minnie.

This is a 2013 reboot of the 1990 Sega Genesis classic of the same name (which I like btw).
How does it hold up, as a game in general and as a reboot?

As a game in general it is pretty good. It is mostly a 2D platformer with 3D graphics, which means that you mostly jump and run from left to right or the other way round. In special parts of the game you have use all key arrows in order to jump on platforms around you or just to run to every corner of a room or bigger platform (like in boss fights).
You need to end three acts of a level and collect diamonds and other items as well as you can (certain amounts of diamonds are needed to get access to future levels).
You defeat enemies by jumping on them or by throwing stuff at them.

So as you can see it is pretty basic and it can be fun for adult players as well as for children. The gameplay also is basic and easy to learn.
However, prepare yourself for a few frustrating moments, especially for quite tricky jumping parts (a good example: the milk shake river and cookies or the final boss fight) and for cutscenes that cannot be skipped (not even the long end credits). 

As a reboot it is alright, not something like the "Ducktales" reboot that amazed and entertained me very much but it is still noticeable that the SEGA team put some work and love for details into this. This also goes for the soundtrack and the lovely voice acting (like when Mickey comments the levels from time to time).

All in all I would call "Castle of Illusion" alright. Not quite awesome - and some flaws really could have been avoided - but good enough to try out. It's definitely something for Disney/Mickey fans.

22392248.review:
A partir de las imágenes del juego original crean los nuevos niveles, intentado copiar y tranmitir la esencia y la jugabilidad a esta versión con 23 años de diferencia. En este caso estamos hablando de una versión completamente renovada, el juego clásico se utiliza de boceto para la nueva jugabilidad y arte.

Es un juego de plataformas, y si hacemos una carrera de tiempo tardariamos menos de dos horas en completarlo. Digamos que está planteado como Trine pero mucho más fácil y rápido, adaptado al concepto de tener prisa por rescatar a la ratona en un castillo de ilusiones, aún así, una cosa que transmite el juego es apostar por ser inteligentes antes que acrobáticos o veloces. El buen desafio y la mayor gracia sería recoger todos los diamantes del nivel porque estos parten sobre el estudio jugable entre lógica ,creatividad, deducciones y bueno ojo, en un escenario 2,5D.

El plataformeo es un salto mecanizado sobre pruebas de tiempo o elementos bajo el desplazamiento, en ningún momento necesitaremos realizar un salto al límite del borde, es eso, mecanizado pero no preciso. El salto comprendería en el apartado de arriba la lógica y la creatividad para crear conjuntos de saltos, y al estar mecanizado la habilidad del control del personaje se reduce a favor de esto. 
El salto, que será prácticamente nuestra única acción se domina a través de pulsaciones largas e intervalos de tiempo largos, el mayor ejemplo está en cuando Mikey aterriza y dobla las piernas para volver a brincar, tendremos un buen tiempo en ese intervalo para decidir si pegar otro brinco o quedarnos quietos. Hace poco probé Comander Keen y es el mismo tipo de salto, sin embargo este también es preciso y la dificultad sube muchisimo. 

Es bastante más corto que Trine y mucho mas simple, carece de cualquier fisica libre y gráficamente es bastante inferior. Sin embargo es igual de completo porque tiene mucho énfasis, si todos quedamos encantados con Trine con este pasará igual.

22358240.review: As a long time gamer, I had the dubious distinction of owning and completing this on both the Master System and Mega Drive versions (couldn't do it now - age gets us all!) and so was curious as to what level of remastering/reimagining this is and I was pleased to find a genuinely entertaining new game heavily inspired by the old.  Everything that was great about the original, the locations, the sense of whimsy had been successfully carried across to this new version along with a fully orchestral soundtrack and a friendly sounding narrator adding the level of Disney gloss that just wasn't possible in the cartridge era.  As much as I enjoyed this game however, there is a feeling of sadness when you realise that the developers where planning to do similar remakes of a lot of Sega properties from that era including Streets of Rage and Golden Axe which will alas never be as Sega shuttered ther studio.  Still, if your looking for a pleasantly challenging old-school platformer with a modern look, this could be ideal.

22357418.review:
Graças ao bom Deus dos Jogos, a SEGA não refez este jogo do jeito que eram os jogos dos anos 80/90, sem SAVE e CONTINUE.

As brigas com os BOSSes são fáceis, mas você vai errar mesmo sabendo o padrão, e o castigo é rever toda cutscene que antecede a luta.

Não cheguei a fechar o jogo original no console (mega-drive ou genesis) no modo normal, apenas no modo fácil, e isso não te dava o direito de assistir a cutscene final. Você apenas recebia uma mensagem de: "agora tente jogar no modo normal".

Já me era esperado que a luta com a Bruxa seria o alge da putaria, algo que me fez levar mais de 1 hora repetindo e repetindo a mesma luta até finalizá-la, já que você chega com 3 estrelas de hitpoint.

Para quem jogou o clássico dos 16bits, uma bela releitura e partida obrigatória! Menção honrosa para a ajuda de meus dois filhos pequenos que deram uma ajuda moral em todos os leveis..

[Nota padrão: 8.8] (se você não jogou o clássico 16bits, veja esta nota)

[Nota pela qualidade do remake: 9.5] (se você jogou o clássico 16bits, veja esta nota)

This is an absolutely beautiful remake on the 1990 Sega Classic of the same name. I used to spend hours playing this game as a kid on our Sega Console and despite the fact that I found it incredibly difficult I loved it none the less. 

This remake fails to disappoint. They have rebuild it exactly like it's original down to the last pixel. The same music, the same enviroments, the same sound effects, with the only differences being a beautiful 3D enviroment, Mickey having a voice and having a Narrator to give you extra information along the way and when you get stuck.

For anyone who used to play the original back on a Sega, this should be a must have for you. The challenge of the original is still there and you won't be sorry you have it.

10/10, gorgeous!
