[b]MUSIC:[/b]

Great music. I'm not too much into orchestral soundtracks but it does the job here. You have access to the original soundtrack from the Sega Genesis if that's what you'd prefer.

[b]GRAPHICS:[/b]

Great graphics for this kind of game and for its price. No complains here.

[b]PHYSICS:[/b]

Sorry! Wrong game! This isn't Sonic but I'll analyze this anyway, they're OK just like in the old game.

[b]LEVEL DESIGN:[/b]

Nice use of 2D to 3D movement shifting. Some stages are quite a challenge, especially if you go for all the gems and collectibles. Movement is mostly in 2D in case you're wondering.

[b]BOSSES:[/b]

Easy, even the final boss. They're OK if you're young or a bit inexperienced at this kind of games but the stages are certainly far harder than the bosses themselves.

[b]ACHIEVEMENTS:[/b]

Easy to 100% if you have a keen eye. Many gems are REALLY well hidden so you have to be clever to get them all. Same for other kind of collectibles.

[b]OVERALL:[/b]

Worth the money. Much more if you buy it on sale (Points at itself, as always). It's as difficult as the old school games, with anticlimatic low difficulty bosses and all!

Get it even if you hate Mickey. I never liked that rat nor any of the Disney characters but I can get past my dislike due to how awesome this game is.

[b]HOW CAN YOU HATE MICKEY???:[/b]

His voice! Ew! Also Bugs Bunny > Mickey Mouse! 8o

10228885.review:
Let me start by saying that the old school Castle of Illusion on Genesis / Mega Drive remains one of my favorite platformers today.

Let me also say that I was hugely, hugely, hugely disappoint by DuckTales Remastered, which I found boring and lazily done.

So I went into this with low expectations ... I mean, how do you live up to a classic? Not sure it's possible, but I was extremely please with the updated Castle of Illusion on Steam. Great game. It does an excellent job taking the source material as inspiration and trying to update it without shitting all over it.

[b]Storyline[/b]
Some witch kidnaps Minnie while she and Mickey are having a picnic. Typical hero save damsel in distress. It works. My only minor complaint is that the intro kind of dragged. The story is so generic that it really seemed a waste of time to draw it out.

[b]Graphics[/b]
Wow. The developers did a great job with this. Whereas with DuckTales Remastered, where the characters looked great but everything else looked like crap ... I was dazzled by Castle of Illusion at ever step. In particular, the second level with the toys ... everything was beautiful.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Here's where I had one of those ooh ahh moments. The old Castle of Illusion is purely a side scrolling platformer, and for the most part, so is the update. However, the developers cleverly integrated some 3D parts into the level design. Not too much. I'd compare it with a great movie director using just enough 3D elements without going overboard.

[b]Level design[/b]
Good variety. There's swimming, jumping, swinging, running-to-avoid. And again, all levels are beautiful. That said, the best levels in my opinion are the first two. After that, it's okay, but not as great as the first two levels.

[b]Collectibles[/b]
In each level you can pick up a card, model and / or chili. And these get you concept art, statutes and costumes (which you can switch into by jumping into the mirror on the third floor). I didn't bother much with completion. I'm not a collectibles or achievements whore. But playing through once normally, I got one outfit and one statute.

[b]Playtime[/b]
I got through this in four hours, without chasing collectibles and achievements. It was short and sweet, which is how platformers should be. The unskippable credits were annoying, especially as it's just names scrolling on a black screen, but I don't care too much about these things.

Overall rating: 8/10. Probably loses a point or two for level design not being consistently great throughout.

Castle of Illusion(2013)-Ремейк Одноимённой игры для Sega Mega Drive 1990 года.Оригинальная игра была одной из моих любимых игр детства.Это был потрясающий платформер с интерсным сюжетом:Колдунья Мизрабель похищает Минни Маус и заключает её в Замок Иллюзий,теперь Микки Маус должен спасти её.Для чего он должен собрать 7[spoiler]Изумрудов хаоса[/spoiler] гемов.

Я рекомендую эту игру всем любителям платформеров,в том числе и тем кто не играл в оригинал.
[h1]Итог: 8/10[/h1]

9939623.review:
Ah, this is the good stuff right here: "Castle of Illusion".  Yeah, baby.  

Hey, look buddy: I'm a grown-up.  I like bourbon after work, fixing motorcycles on the weekend, and watching my wife cook me breakfast in her bathrobe.  But dang it if I don't love me some "Castle of Illusion".  Nothin wrong with that.

Almost every one I know who owned a Sega Genesis back in the day played this game.  Today, I have kids myself but you better believe I'm going to play this game first before I let them get their hands on it.

This is a remake done right.  Not only will you enjoy this game for the nostalgia factor if you played the original back in 1990, but it's a solid "collect-the-items platformer" as well.  Short, yes, and nothing "rogue-like" about it (and that's a good thing, just like the original!),  but absolutely charming and entertaining, improving upon all the reasons why the original game was so great: pleasing soundtrack (same tunes-- thankfully, nicely re-arranged and re-done), surreal graphics, solid character control, and the newly-added option of being able to return to any level to grab up those items you might have missed on your first (or fifth) run.  

Bottom line: only the most jaded hipster rogue-lover would not find this game fun.  Do yourself a favor and pick this game up before you buy "Super Indie Hamster Runner" or "Sandwich Simulator 2014".  You'll be glad you did.  And tell 'em Okihara Jones sent ya!

9918047.review:
Is the game recommendable? Yes, if you enjoy platformers and a Disney storyline. The actual story was a bit corny, but the game itself was pretty entertaining and well-made, with half a dozen semi-interesting boss-fights. The game is however only a few hours worth of gameplay (to 100% it even), so it serves as a nice game to play when you feel like playing something casual.

Castle of Illusion is first and foremost a remake of the old SEGA Genesis game by the same title. The game is in essence the exact same as the original, in the sense that it features the same maps, the same boss-fights, the same enemies (mostly), but it does so in what is literally a future version of the game. 

Back in 1990 when the original was made, the majority of the mechanics they made use of in the remake (2013) were simply impossible to achieve, such as making use of 3D gameplay. While the 2013 remake is mostly a 2D sidescroller (staying true to the original), it does on occassion let you run freely in a 3D space, and it does so very seamlessly while entering and leaving those spaces. 

The remake's art is basically based on the same art that the original had, but with a major overhaul in actual graphics and style, as in, you will find the same type of forest, the same kind of castle, the same kind of various areas throughout the remake that you found in the original, just with a modernized style (aka the remake is not a 16-bit game :p)

9898501.review: 이 게임은 딱 게임이다. 어린시절 메가드라이브라던지 슈퍼패미콤 시절의 게임을 즐겼던 유저라면 재밌게 플레이 하지 않을까? 요즘같이 실사과 같은 3D 엔진을 사용하는 게임들이 즐비할때 가끔은 이런 게임이 불감증을 해소해주지 않을까 싶다. 적어도 나는 게임을 하는 내내 아주 즐겁게 즐겼다. 먼저 아쉬운점은 너무 작은 볼륨이다. 보스까지 총 6개의 스테이지로 각 스테이지 별로 2개의 맵 중간 보스가 존재하는데 하나의 맵마다 5~ 10분 미만으로 클리어가 가능하기때문에 별도의 공략 없이도 단조롭게 플레이 할 수 있기 때문이다. 좀더 숨겨진 미션이라던지 숨은 장소들이 있었다면 볼륨이 좀더 컷더라면 더욱 재밌지는 않았을까 한다. 만약 공략을 보며 게임을 즐긴다면 2시간짜리 게임으로 전락할것 같지만. 공략을 보지 않더라도 5시간 미만으로 2번의 엔딩을 물론 모든 도전과제 완료 및 수집품을 모을 수 있을 것이다. 너무 재밌게 플레이 했지만 너무 작은 볼륨에 약간 아쉬움도 남으며, 자녀가 있거나 어린 조카들과 함께 즐긴다면 더욱 재밌을것이다. 더군다나 쉬운 영어 문장과 동화가 같은 내용이기 때문에 영어도 알려주며 즐긴다면 더욱 재밌을 것이다. 그 외에는 나는 너무재밌게 즐겼다. 방향키와 2개의 버튼(점프와 던지기) 만으로 플레이가 가능하며 아기자기한 그레픽은 지친 게임생활에 더욱 할기가 띌것이다.  한국에서는 지역제한이라 다른 판매처를 통해

9881513.review:
The magic of love！
为了救出被邪恶女巫掠走的女友，我们将扮演米老鼠在幻影城堡中展开一段奇幻的童话冒险。城堡内有许多锁着的大门，分别通向不同的魔法世界，需要通过积累钻石来逐一解锁（很像马里奥N64）。游戏不仅画面精美，音乐动听，而且非常有趣，每个关卡都设计的别具匠心，不同特色的主题，设置巧妙的陷阱，个性鲜明的敌人，穿插其中的解谜要素和收集要素，让整个冒险旅程既紧张又刺激，每过一关都是一种快乐的享受。
PC上难得的横（纵）版动作佳作，强烈推荐，跟着米奇来体验一段美妙的梦幻之旅吧！

9881234.review: Kurzes aber unterhaltsames Jump & Run mit Mickey Mouse. Die Geschichte ist schnell erklärt; rette Minnie Mouse! Jedes 'Kapitel' ist in 3 Abschnitte unterteilt und spielt in einer komplett anderen Gegend. Mal lauft und springt Ihr durch einen Zauberwald, mal durch eine Bibliothek ein anderes Mal durch ein Schlaraffenland. Die unterschiedlichen Gegenden sehen toll aus, der Anspruch ist allerdings auf einem ziemlich geringen Niveau.. selbst die im 3. Abschnitt immer wieder auftauchenden Endgegner sind äußerst simpel. Lediglich der letzte Endgegner lies mich ein Weilchen rätseln. Für den vollen Preis würde ich mir die Anschaffung aufgrund der kurzen Spieldauer zweimal überlegen, wer den Stil aber mag und das Spiel für 5,- € bekommt macht mit Castle of Illusion definitiv nichts verkehrt. Mir persönlich hat 'Ducktales Remastered' allerdings eine ganze Ecke besser gefallen, das lag am im komplett in 2D gehaltenen Grafikstil, die Vorliebe zu Dagobert und Co. aber auch an dem größeren Umfang der sich durch viele Extras bemerkbar machte. Extras gibt es zwar auch in Castle of Illusion beispielsweiße freischaltbare Kostüme für Mickey oder Statuen für das Schloss in dem man die einzelnen Kapitel nach und nach anwählt, allerdings konnten diese mich nicht so lange motivieren wie in 'Ducktales Remastered'.. dennoch eine absolute Empfehlung. :)

9765569.review:
Bom. Vejamos o que posso dizer sobre este jogo. Ele é um Platform muito bom. E pra um jogo do Mickey esta excelente. Em resumo eu poderia dizer. Se voce gosta de Mario, Rayman, Little Big Planet, etc, então é bem provavel que voce goste desse jogo. E se voce gostou de Epic Mickey, ha algumas chances de voce gostar desse jogo também. Bem como DuckTales: Remastered.

A história do jogo é bem simples mesmo. UMa bruxa do sequestrou a minie e o Mickey tem que ir salva-la antes que ela roube a "beleza" da Minie. Mas apesar de simples, é bem divertida e bem narrada a história. O narrador da história também foi muito bem colocado no jogo. Pra quem gosta do personagem Mickey Mouse (protagonista do jogo) este jogo vai ser um prato cheio.

A gameplay do jogo é bem simples e divertida. É de facil entendimento. Andar, pular e atirar alguns objetos. Simples assim. O jogo possuí varios mundinhos, ao termino de cada um, tem um chefe. Aliás, as boss fights, são muito divertidas. Para derrotar os inimigos, voce tem que  pular encima dele ou atirar um objeto. Esses objetos variam com a temática do mundo. Por exemplo, no mundinho da floresta, voce atira maças, no mundinho dos doces, voce atira umas balinhas, no mundinho dos brinquedos, voce atira aquelas bolinhas de brinquedo, etc. Os inimigos do jogo variam com a temática do mundinho também. Os chefes também.

As músicas do jogo estão muito boas. Elas combinam muito bem com o cenário e com as situações apresentadas no jogo.

Os cenários estão ótimos. Se voce gosta dos desenhos do Mickey, voce vai encontrar os mais diversos cenários e inimigos que existem no universo do Mickey.

Os gráficos do jogo estão bons. Pra um jogo deste porte podemos dizer que esta ótimo. Só que eu esperava resolução Full HD, mas tudo bem.

Não encontrei bugs nem glitchs no jogo.

Muitas lembranças nostalgicas me vem com este jogo. Não só dos desenhos do MIckey que assisti na minha infancia, mas tabém de jogos anteriores que tive do mesmo, de muito antigamente. Pessoalmente, este jogo além de ser muito bom, é meio nostalgico para mim. Este definitivamente é um jogo que recomendo. Se voce gosta de jogos estilo platform, voce não vai se arrepender. Vale cada centavo. E se voce é um fã do Mickey, voce ja deveria estar jogando.

9755760.review:
The original Castle of Illusion is a quaint platformer that came out on the Genesis before the likes of Sonic and all the ridiculous clones that followed. It's a short but memorable journey through five unique worlds as Mickey tries to rescue Minne from a witch. Not quite a classic but thoroughly competent and entertaining.

As far as remakes go this is one of the better titles I've played. Instead of going for a shot by shot remake, this edition focuses on taking the setpieces of the original and re-imagining them. Bosses have more ornate patterns, there are optional areas to explore, and fans of the original will see familiar areas filled with different challenges.

Actually challenge probably isn't a word I can throw around when I talk about this game. This version is quite a bit easier than the original. The difficulty curve is more balanced, and doesn't have absolutely brutal enemies or force Mickey to survive long stretches while having only two or three hitpoints to work with. 

While Castle of Illusion is a short game, I actually don't mind. This is probably due to the era I grew up in but platformers with dozens upon dozens of stages tend to just wear me out. The developer behind this game took what was available in the original and stretched it out just enough. You're not going to see a bunch of stages with only slight differences or a couple gimmicks between them. The pacing is reasonable. Whenever you have an afternoon free, you can run through this game in its entirety and get the full experience.

The controls and mechanics - the life-blood of any decent platformer - are very well-done. As far as complaints go I only have one, the soundtrack. The best Castle of Illusion tunes are the arranged versions of the original. There are a couple songs exclusive to this remake but they're bland and uninteresting. An option exists to use the Genesis music in the game, which is nice although it tends to clash with the voice-work(expect to hear Mickey and a narrator talk fairly often).

All in all this is a solid title.

9739121.review:
Mickey et Minnie en train de valser sur une mélodie joyeuse, sautillant sur quelques notes de celles qui marquent une enfance. Même s'il a souffert de la comparaison avec un certain Quackshot dont il partageait la cartouche, sans parler des autres monuments Disney, Castle of Illusion Starrig Mickey Mouse a réussi à se creuser un trou douillet au coeur de ce que mes jeunes années de joueur se souviennent de plus tendre.

Autant commencer par ce qui fait mal : le gameplay de ce remake, imprécis et flottant, ne rend pas honneur à l'original. On parle d'un jeu de plates-formes. Aïe. Ca fait quelques années déjà que les équipes de SEGA peinent à livrer un gameplay 2D dynamique et fluide, à croire que dans leur panique ils en sont réduits à recruter chez Media Molecule. C'est triste mais il faut regarder la vérité en face : la mythique firme japonaise qui a signé les génériques de tellement de plateformers cultes manque aujourd'hui de savoir-faire dans ses rangs. Mais certainement pas de bonne volonté. Ce ne sont donc pas pour ses qualités ludiques (attention, on est tout de même très loin du calvaire) mais bien évidemment pour la magie de la nostalgie que ce nouveau Castle peut prétendre faire Illusion et mériter les quelques euros demandés. En cela ce remake est à conseiller aux vrais amoureux du premier opus et à eux seuls.

Si on retrouve le pitch de base, une partie du bestiaire ainsi que certains thèmes visuels et sonores (on pourra même préférer les anciennes musiques depuis les options), c'est à un tout nouveau jeu que nous avons affaire. Les gars de SEGA Australia ont profité de l'occasion pour garnir les nouveaux niveaux de plein de petites idées de game et de level design malheureusement trop peu exploitées, la faute à des stages trop rapidement expédiés pour laisser le temps au joueur de s'imprégner de leur atmosphère et de leurs mécanismes. Le jeu est d'ailleurs aussi court et facile que son ancêtre. Si Castle of Illusion 2013 n'arrive pas à la cheville de l'original et encore moins à celle d'un certain Wild Adventure/Mania, on a envie de lui pardonner tous ses défauts parce qu'on a tout simplement envie de l'aimer. J'ai envie de l'aimer. Malgré la légion d'imperfections qui gâchent le tableau, les développeurs ont vraiment livré un travail sérieux, varié et plein de petites subtilités. Enfermé dans son désir d'être satisfait, on reste plongé dans son rêve, un monde parallèle où tout y est mieux, on ne ressort la tête à la surface que pour entrevoir d'un oeil ce qu'aurait pu donner le jeu sous un meilleur jour, suite à quoi on replonge pour toujours. Il faut réunir tellement de conditions pour accrocher à ce remake qu'en définitive je voudrais ne le conseiller qu'à moi ; et pourtant je suis convaincu de ses qualités véritables qui ne relèvent pas toutes du fantasme. Si vous vous sentez l'âme d'un de mes clones, sait-on jamais...

9726908.review:
Numa época que as produtoras e desenvolvedoras sentem falta de novas idéias, virou modinha fazer reboot, versão HD ou remake de games. Franquias famosas agora lançam jogos semestrais sem nada de novo. São poucas as empresas que arriscam em lançar coisas novas.

Agora quando uma empresa se propõe a fazer um remake ela precisa ter em mente que o jogo deve ser uma homenagem ao game original. Esse tipo de manobra deve ser direcionada aos antigos jogadores que sempre sonharam em ver seu jogo predileto reinterpretado numa nova versão. E nesse quesito a Sega teve a maestria de fazer um remake com ABSOLUTO respeito ao game original.

Por isso eu já vou falando antes de mais nada: Castle of Illusion é um game de plataforma feito pra quem jogou o original de 1990 no Genesis (Mega Drive). Que original? Esse aqui ó:

http://youtu.be/SiT1J5DzSJo

Se você nunca jogou esse game ou nem é tão fã do Mickey, recomendo buscar outros games de plataforma, como os Rayman da Ubisoft ou um dos Trine da Frozenbyte. Castle of Illusion pode não te agradar, já que para nossa época é um game simples e curto.

Castle of Illusion foi um dos primeiros jogos que joguei no Genesis e eu o achava lindo. Junto com o Sonic, esse game praticamente inaugurou o console da Sega e iniciou a batalha com a Nintendo na guerra de consoles da década de 90.

Esse remake está simplesmente ÓTIMO. Ele não é uma versão remasterizada nem uma versão HD. O game foi totalmente REPENSADO, em todos os sentidos, desde o desenho dos personagens, suas animações, a interação com os cenários, sempre RESPEITANDO o original. Eu realmente me senti jogando o mesmo game, mas muito mais lindo e profundo.

A complexidade do game continua extremamente baixa. Pode até ser considerado um game para crianças a partir dos 6 ou 7 anos, pois possui uma dificuldade super baixa e é claro, é o Mickey com toda a sua conduta politicamente correta que não irá poluir a mente do futuro do nosso país. :)

Uma nota especial para a música que foi também repensada com carinho, mas mais especialmente pela possibilidade de você poder ouvir a trilha original de 1990. Isso deu uma imersão gigantesca me levando diretamente ao passado de 25 anos atrás.

Qualquer um deve terminar o game no máximo em 2h. Fiz 100% em 5h.
Certamente Castle of Illusion é uma homenagem merecida ao clássico e um presente aos gamers véiacos da década de 90.

9724194.review: Castle of Illusion est un petit jeu sympa pour passer de bons moments en famille et émerveiller les plus jeunes. La réalisation est plutôt correcte et les graphismes de bonnes factures. Il ne s’agit pas là d'un hit en puissance, mais il devrait ravir les fans de Mickey. J'ai acheté Castle of Illusion pour jouer avec mon petit garçon, mais il est pour le moment trop petit pour réussir à jouer correctement, alors il me regarde dans le feu de l'action. Je ne pense pas qu'il sera prêt à y jouer avant quelques années, car j'ai trouvé le game-play un poil trop difficile pour les joueurs occasionnels. Globalement, le titre n'est pas insurmontable loin de là puisqu'il se boucle aisément en moins de deux heures. Cependant, Mickey est incapable de s'agripper à un rebord ce qui est un vrai problème au jeu de la jouabilité approximative. J'ai également trouvé la progression mal équilibrée ce qui pourra en rebuter plus d'un, mais une petite astuce consiste à recommencer un niveau afin de récolter le maximum d'étoiles représentant le niveau d'énergie de Mickey. De cette façon, les boss deviennent nettement moins difficiles que si on avait enchaîné les trois nivaux d'affilés. Malgré ces petites lacunes, Castle of Illusion est une valeur sûre à essayer seule ou en famille selon votre préférence.

9709281.review:
To summarize my impression of this game, I would say that it is a very, very faithful remake of a 24 year old jewel, both in its pro's and con's. 
At the same time being short and obviously made for kids, just like the original, the game manages to brilliantly use the now-available multimedia power of this decade to exponentialize the magical atmosphere and gameplay. 
The level design is overall cool. Cool as in "above ok". Truth be said, it could be amazing if they used the GameGear/Master System version as template, instead of the - sorry purists - shitty Genesis version, which at the time was a game with the only purpose of promoting the newborn Sega Genesis with its good looks. It was 1990 after all, the beginning of the legendary 16-bit generation.
So anyway, they're basically a re-imagining of those levels, which thank god made them better in the end (which wasn't such a hard task after all).
In the end, I have to say it's a game made for the fans of the original. There's no denying it. 
New players will find it, unless they are REALLY open minded, too damn short (one can finish in a little more than 2 hours) and overall too easy and simple. Like I said, made for kids. 
The magic is there for sure, both for new players and old onse, but to be quite honest, it's value resides more in being a piece of nostalgia from the old days than anything else. Something that only the veterans of the original (btw, we are fucking old now, I hope you realize it :) ) will have.
But despite all that, I still don't think the game is worth its full price. 
If we assume the game is on a reasonable discount (more than 50%) I would evaluate it as a 6/10 game for new players. For veterans, 8/10.
Thanks for reading.

9702599.review:
Zu den Guten Seiten des Spiels gehört, das es einen  recht klassischen Sidescroller Jump&Run Titel handelt. Die Grafik ist sehr schön und die Disney-Thematik mit Micky in der Hauptrolle ist sehr gut umgesetzt. Es macht auch durchaus Spaß und wenn man es sehr günstig bekommt wird man es wohl auch kaum bereuen. 

Trotzdem kann ich es nicht wirklich weiterempfehlen. Zum einen ist die Steuerung (mit Gamepad gespielt) nicht ganz astrein. Zu oft kann man nicht oder zu spät sehen, wo man landet und fällt irgendwo runter oder springt zu weit. 
In manchen Leveln ist auch nicht ganz ersehbar, wo der "begehbare Teil" ist und wo der Hintergrund, weswegen man auch oft zu Tode fällt. 
An manchen Stellen ist der Rücksetzpunkt so doof gelegt, das man sich immer irgendwelche Sequenzen anschauen muß. 

Zudem ist das Spiel recht schwer, dafür das es eigentlich eine eher kindliche Thematik hat (Vielleicht werd ich auch langsam alt). 
Zudem bietet das Spiel eigentlich nichts besonderes. Man läuft und springt durch die Level und wenn man nicht auf Erfolgsjagd aus ist, hat man das Ende in 3 Stunden gesehen. "Fünf Magische Welten" bestehen aus jeweils 2 Level und einem Boss-Level in dem es nur den Boss zu besiegen gilt. 
Zudem hat Micky keine "besonderen Fähigkeiten". Er kann nur Springen und "Schießen". Doppelsprung, Schwebeflug und sonstige "Rafinessen" sucht man leider vergeblich. Auch bekommt er keine neuen Fähigkeiten hinzu. 
Wie gesagt, kann man noch auf Erfolgejagd gehen. In jedem Level gibt es 75 Edelsteine zu finden, eine Silberstatue und eine Chillischote. Oft fehlen einem aber einige Sachen auch nach mehrmaligen Absuchens. Das bedeutet dann zusätzliche Recherche im Internet. 

Ebenfalls blöd: Wenn ich im Level/im Spiel das Spiel beenden will, geht man auf "Spiel beenden". Das Spiel lädt den "Vorbildschirm". Man muß "Start drücken um das Spiel zu starten", dann wird das Menü geladen und dann kann man das Spiel endgültig verlassen. Fand ich immer ziemlich nervig. Warum kann ich nicht gleich zurück zum Desktop?

Wie gesagt. Alles in allem ein nettes Spiel, aber gespielt haben muß man es eigentlich nicht. Zu Kurz und an vielen Stellen einfach zu unfair, was die Gegeneraufteilung angeht.

9682834.review:
Castle of Illusion tem um lugar especial em minha memória. Foi o primeiro jogo de Master System que eu zerei e o Primeiro de Mega Drive que eu joguei/zerei.

Quando foi anunciado o remake de Castle of Illusion fiquei bem empolgado, mas ao ver que ai ser em 3D eu fiquei com o pé atrás já que a maioria dos remakes de jogos 2D feitos em 3D não me agradaram por fugir demais do que era o original.

Em Castle of Illusion os caras acertaram em cheio na forma de transpor o original 2D para 3D. O jogo ficou com gráficos e trilha sonora maravilhosa sem perder a essência da jogabilidade original. Aliás todas as fases tem um bocado de elementos adicionados em relação ao original mas em completa sintonia com o que já existia. A jogabilidade é majoritariamente 2D, e mesmo nos pequenos trechos onde a jogabilidade passa de 2D para 3D, ficou muito bacana.

Como no original o jogo é fácil e curto, mas nessa versão tem o adicional de completar 100% do jogo coletando todos os itens (para quem curte esse tipo de coisa) o que extende um pouco mais o jogo. Eu joguei ele com calma olhando cenários e explorando um bocado e prestando atenção nos detalhes e mesmo assim demorei menos de 3 horas para salvar a Minnie e 7,5hrs pra completar 100% do jogo. O povo mais apressado vai fazer ambos em bem menos tempo.

O único ponto onde acho que podiam ter feito melhor foi na introdução e final... ao invés das imagens estáticas, deveriam ter usado a própria engine 3D do jogo nelas e as feito totalmente animadas. Ou ainda melhor... ter feito elas em animação no estilo da Disney, ou mesmo feito pela própria Disney. Ai teria ficado perfeito. Mesmo assim ainda acho que o jogo merece nota 10/10.

Recomendado para todos. Obrigatório pra quem é fã do jogo original.

9670876.review: Castle of Illusion is a remake of the classic Genesis game of the same name. When Minnie Mouse gets kidnapped by the evil Mizerabel, it's up to Mickey Mouse to venture into her Castle of Illusions, collect the Rainbow Gems to defeat Mizerabel, and save Minnie. The game is a simple platform game that combines 2D and 3D gameplay. You jump and throw objects to defend yourself against Mizerabel's minions. It's colorful graphics, wonderful music, and fun gameplay is what makes the game shine. There are a lot of secret passages and specific items to collect which will unlock artwork, statues and costumes. The only thing I don't like is that the narrator can sometimes be annoying as he narrats througout the entire game, but other than that, Castle of Illusions is a fantastic remake. Being more familer with platforming games I found this to be somewhat of a breeze, with it's share of difficulty. Course I'll be kept busy if I decide to complete the game 100%. So in conclusion, this game is wonderful. Newcomers might find the game challenging, while old school gamers will find this to be a walk in the park and relive some nostalgic memories.

9656740.review:
Nostalgia outra vez aqui na Steam, com este clássico do gênero fantasy-adventure platformer. Agora, eu não podia deixar de pelo menos iniciar uma Análise sobre Castle of Illusion, simplesmente porque, já de início, ele me "encheu" os olhos... Você se lembra dos tempos de que tudo era mais... tão inocente, bonito, sem maldade e, é claro, sempre com uma boa dose de fantasia? Então. Esse jogo não é um "port", é um REMAKE e convenhamos, QUE remake! O que temos aqui é uma reformulação totalmente em 3D (ou seria melhor definido um 2.5D? alguém me corrige por favor), por você poder andar com o Mickey não somente para trás e pra frente, mas também tem caminhos que vão para cima (horizonte). O jogo foi muito bem adaptado para o PC, foi feito com carinho, óbvio! O que não é um "recurso" utilizado de praxe pelos Developers, mas que quando é, então para a nossa grata satisfação, é rapidamente percebido. Ok, para muitos Castle of Illusion pode ser visto como "mais um joguinho na biblioteca Steam", mas considere por favor, quando eu falo, que ele vale muito a pena, PRINCIPALMENTE se você for um Gamer nostálgico, saudosista e que nunca deixa morrer aquela criança interior!

E eu o comprei com 75% de desconto... what a steal!

Até o momento 10/10! Estarei atualizando minha análise (se necessário for), para menos ou para mais, assim que eu tiver mais horas de jogo!

-DarkSpider

9228391.review:
Provavelmente, a maioria dos gamers já sentiram saudade de games, bons games que foram lançados nas velhas gerações de consoles e por um instante se imaginou jogando esses renomados títulos novamente.

Castle of ilusion veio com um remake quase impecável, brilhante, pronto para dar um golpe final na nostalgia e saciar a vontade da velha geração de gamers de ter o prazer de desfrutar novamente dessa dentre várias relíquias das indústrias dos games. E para atual geração, uma ótima oportunidade de jogar um divertido game de abrilhantar os olhos.

Quando comecei a jogar, não sabia se ficava prestando atenção no jogo ou se ficava admirando os belíssimos cénários refeitos de forma muito bem criativa e aprimorados.

O game ficou muito bom, comandos simples como manda a série, jogabilidade muito agradável e fácil. As boas trilhas sonoras da versão do 16 bits, foram refeitas e cada uma mais legal que a outra, "canta" enquanto os nostálgicos cenários "encanta".

A ausência de desafio gradativo é o ponto fraco do game. Conforme avançava no jogo, a impressão que tive é que só deveria correr em direção a vitória certa e os continues são absurdamente fartos. Parece que eles até fizeram esse remake pensando em agradar a todos: Ambiente,Gráficos  e trilhas sonoras para os gamers que já jogaram a versão antiga, e dificuldade mais fácil para nova geração toddynho!

Castle of ilusion é uma boa fusão do mundo de animação, fantasia e encanto que a Walt Disney sabe muito bem produzir mais a fantástica fábrica de maravilhas que é esse mundo dos vídeo games! E com certeza vale a pena jogar!!!

Even on the very beginning levels, the controls are too frustrating to get basic jumping mechanisms.  It does say it's better with a game controller, so maybe my problem is I was trying to use a keyboard.  Still, that's no excuse for having a game that's so frustrating to play it isn't fun.

С оригиналом, вышедшим в 1990 на Sega Genesis и Mega Drive я ранее знаком не был, как и с портом 1998 года на Sega Saturn, но как по мне воссоздание оригинала в современном виде (именно так, это не ремейк как таковой по сути) в целом удалось, но лично мне больше понравился классический, 16-битный стиль, после того, как посмотрел это сравнение - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=95x4b47I81w Вопрос в другом - стоит ли он, ремейк, пристального внимания сегодня?...

На фоне целой череды инди-платформеров, тех же Braid, Limbo, Super Meat Boy игра смотрится довольно скучно. Игра более проста в прохождении в сравнении с большинством нынешних платформеров. Местами есть примечательные моменты. В целом если пройдёте мимо, ничего по существу не потеряете.

С другой стороны игра довольно короткая, у меня ушло на неё 4 часа, без учёта, довольно, я бы сказал, сложного, сбора всех предметов в игре, чем я не стал заниматься. Ввиду этого может быть рекомендована тем, кому интересно "пощупать концепцию" того, что представляют из себя "воссоздания" в каком-то плане классики такого сорта платформеров.

Всем прочим, желающим понастальгировать, я бы больше рекомендовал подождать, когда выйдет ремейк Чип и Дейла или Чёрного плаща (или поиграть в 16-битный оригинал, благо есть эмуляторы). Пока таковых никем не запланировано, но вот это были бы точно те случаи, когда можно было сказать однозначно - стоит оно того или нет.

9123272.review:
Pro

-Livelli: Realizzati benissimo, ogni ambiente ha il suo fascino. molto ben fatto direi.

-narrazione: Ottima! Sembrava di giocare a Trine 2 a livelli di narrazione

-Gameplay: Teoricamente Ottimo! purtroppo la modalità è parecchio facile (giustamente, penso sia un gioco per i bambini), però sinceramente potevano aggiungere dalle impostazioni di gioco le classiche difficoltà "facile - media - difficile"
Tutto il gioco è stato piacevole giocarlo, ma per tutto il tempo è stato  troppo facile (ametto che l'ultimo boss l'ho trovato difficile e l'avrò sconfitto dopo 20 tentativi).

Contro

-Longevità: molto corta, si finisce in 2 ore.

-Impostazioni del gioco: Mancano quelle essenziali ovvero il livello di difficoltà (come ho spiegato sul gameplay) e i commandi, i commandi del gioco sono le freccie direzionali, il salto e il "lancio dell'oggetto". Qua non puoi impostare i commandi come vuoi, sono stabiliti così e li devi giocare così.

-Trama: Classica, Strega che rapisca la ragazza ecc,ecc,ecc  (non è proprio un contro visto che è un gioco di topolino, ma di certo non posso metterlo nei pro)


Lo consiglio nonostante la longevità corta e il gameplay facile. Prezzo pieno assolutamente no vista la durata, compratelo quanto costerà poco.

9060935.review:
I'm generally weary of retro remakes and "reimagined" properties and have been burned in the past.  However, this game was definitely done right.  The spirit of the original Genesis version is captured very well.  The graphics and platforming have been updated enough to fit modern ideas of what a game should be, but you can easily identifiy every part of the game with the original, and the added content isn't overbearing.

The addition of the Mario 64-like lobby for level selection was a nice touch, and I really appreciate that most of the original Genesis music is recognizable in its remade form.  The game is a bit short, but I think lengthening the actual platforming sections might have taken something away from its integrity.  They did add the collectables and a few unlocks to length it a bit, but some may not care for such things.  If that's the case, just wait to pick up the game when it hits a price point you are comfortable with.

That clown boss is still scary as hell, even 20+ years later.

9017589.review:
Perhaps I'm just a cynical bigot blinded by nostalgia, but in my eyes Disney has lost quite a bit of its magic in recent years. Instead of the delightfully imaginative works of their glory years, we've been "treated" to an abundance of derivative shovel-ware and cash grabs, all relying on their branding and marketing instead of actual quality to make them a success. A remake of the Sega Genesis/Mega Drive classic, Castle of Illusion could have very well been just another mediocre licensed game, but to my absolute surprise and delight it is anything but; a whimsical joy of a platformer that pays homage to Mickey's past, while bringing him into the modern day just as enjoyable as we remember him.

Opening like the typical fairy tale it is, Mickey and Minnie are just setting out for a picnic when the witch Mizrabel spies the pair and gets jealous, swooping in and kidnapping Minnie, with the goal of using the damsel's youth and beauty to rejuvenate herself from the old hag she is. Mickey will have none of this however, and thus enters the titular Castle of Illusion to obtain the seven magic gems, cross the rainbow bridge, and get his girl back!

Like the 1990 original, CoI is a basic platformer whose strength lies in its imaginative levels and environments. Each stage is unique and bustling with creativity, from a giant library full of bouncing letters and slinking bookworms, to a world made entirely out of sweets that has you swimming through jello and bouncing on cookies floating in a milkshake river. There are so many charming little touches in every location you traverse that I couldn't begin to name them all (and doubt I saw even half of them). Sega perfectly captured the happy-go-lucky mannerisms of Mickey, right down to the trademark hop in his step and chip of his voice, an attention to detail which extends to every secret area and extra path, and makes for an immensely enjoyable game. I gleefully made my way through every level never once tiring of the seemingly endless stream of fantastical places I was sent to, but alas every good thing must come to an end and CoI does so all too soon.

For all its wonder and the many things it gets so very right, CoI is over in a heartbeat (around 2-3 hours to be exact). This short-live adventure seems to end even more abruptly, do to how easy it is to jump from one level to the next and how quickly and seamlessly they flow together. In a sense it's about as long as the average animated movie (which almost seems intentional, opening and ending with the camera panning out to a theater), but for a $15 game it had me wanting more. 

I say that however with the caveat of wanting more because I loved my brief time with Mickey so much. Castle of Illusion is a pleasure and has given me hope that Disney is still capable of creating something with as much heart and wonder as what made them a household name in the first place. If Mickey Mouse has ever meant anything to you, you owe it to yourself to play this lively tribute that does as much for giving the icon a proper video game outing, as it does a starting point for what could (and hopefully does) come out in the near future. It's pure childish fun that capitalizes on its goal of being a lighthearted game that almost anyone can enjoy, recapturing the magic of yesteryear for the new and old generation alike.

[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2014/02/08/castle-of-illusion-review/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]

Очень крутая, но короткая игра. Думаю, особо скилловые товарищи пройдут ее за 3-4 часа. Впрочем, и в ее короткости опять же плюс - не успевает надоесть. Сложность невысокая, но если есть желание задрочить все ачивки, тогда уже придется постараться, так как с этим сложность повышается в разы. 
Из серьезных минусов: нельзя выключить бэкграунд мьюзик и нет настройки конфигурации. 
Из серьезных плюсов: почти все остальное! Графон в игре отличный, цвета очень мимими, уровни все разные, попрыгать можно и на макарунах, и буковки поубивать, и в облаках повитать. В конце каждого уровня босс, который проходится тактикой запоминания его "фаз". Ни один босс не заставит ломать клавиатуру, но лично мне это очень даже нравится. 8760862.review:
Pésima optimización que lo hace casi injugable.
El juego en su máxima calidad es una auténtica belleza, pero para poder mover eso hará falta una máquina muy potente. Teniendo un portátil con i7 y un gráfica que ha movido sin problemas juegos más complejos a 720p, he tenido que reducir la resolución a 800x600 y desactivar todos los efectos, puesto que con los niveles visuales por defecto, apenas se movía entre 5-10 fps. Aún así, en numerosos momentos el framerate bajaba muy por debajo de los 30fps, haciendo complicado poder seguir jugando, porque al pegar el bajón también se produce retardo en la respuesta de los controles.
En cuanto al juego, muy bonito, melodías acordes al ambiente clásico Disney, aunque muy corto.
Únicamente lo recomiendo a aquél que tenga un PC de última generación.

8701335.review:
Este jogo teve seu auge na época dos 16 bits, no finado Mega Drive, contava com uma jogabilidade e trilha sonora ótima para aquela geração.
Em sua nova versão remasterizada os ambientes das fases são totalmente exploráveis em cenários lindamente desenhados e com uma trilha sonora fantástica, digna de obras da Disney.
Tudo começa quando Mickey recebe a missão de salvar sua namorada, Minnie, que é sequestrada pela bruxa má Mizrabel. 8528529.review:
emake du fameux Castle of Illusion qui était au line-up de la megadrive, un jeu de plateforme très simpliste mais plutôt solide dans lequel on joue mickey pour sauver minnie (:D). 
 
C'est ici un remake "inspiration" (contrairement à duck tales remastered par exemple qui est une bête version HD calquée sur l'original jusqu'à reproduire volontairement des défauts de gameplay) avec des passages 3D et un nouveau level design, mais une progression calquée sur le jeu original. On a le choix entre la musique de la megadrive et des nouvelles musiques (prendre celle de la megadrive pour l'effet nostalgie++). Le jeu n'est pas bien long (tout comme le jeu dont il s'inspire), peut-être 2H pour un run si vous n'êtes pas manchot, la difficulté est correcte, on ne s'ennuie pas trop mais on ne rage pas non plus, il y a quelques bidules à collectionner pour taper un vrai 100% (mais bon j'ai terminé à 720/800 en first run donc compter 2H de plus pour un full 100% des chaumières peut-être). 
 
C'était à l'origine un très mauvais port mais il a été patché récemment pour activer le 60FPS (...) et résoudre de gros problèmes de perf et je n'ai pas eu de soucis majeur en y jouant. La réalisation est plutôt bonne (pour un port bâclé), le jeu est plaisant, pour vraiment apprécier il faut bien sur l'effet nostalgie++ (si vous n'avez jamais joué à castle of illusion, passez votre chemin à mon avis), on passe quelques bonnes heures et on range, c'est probablement un peu cher pour ce que c'est mais en dessous de 3$ et si vous voulez vous faire un petit trip nostalgie, je recommande.

8499456.review:
Castle of Illusion is a really fun platform game. It's all out running, jumping, stomping your enemies, swinging, swimming, the usual. You collect diamonds along the way to unlock the subsequent levels. You don't need anywhere near the 800 possible diamonds to proceed, however. More diamonds, chili peppers, statues, and playing cards unlock costumes and really bland concept art as paintings in the castle. 

The story is a traditional Disney fairy tale. Mickey and Minnie are in love. The witch captures Minnie. Mickey goes to save the day. The narration reads like it's from a child's storybook. It's nothing that will blow your mind, but if you love Disney, you'll enjoy the story. Mickey and the other characters sound great, exactly like you'd expect them to, though their dialogue is limited.

The graphics update for this game is phenomenal. It's gorgeous artwork in the traditional Disney style. 

Level design is exceptional, reminding me of the charm of games on the original Nintendo and Genesis systems. Each level has a theme and all the obstacles fit well within the theme. 

At times the game makes you move quickly as platformers traditionally do and you need to make quick reactions as the floors fall out from under you. It does feel like a bit of a memorize and repeat formula at times and can be a bit frustrating if the checkpoint is a bit further back. 

Boss battles are unique each time, as the various monsters have different themed attack patterns. The forest tree boss rolls like a log, the toy world boss is a jack in the box that jumps around and tosses a spring-loaded boxing glove your way, etc. 

The controls are very simple and worked perfectly on the XBOX controller for Windows. I would have liked an option to pan the camera to look around the immediate area for hidden collectables (as that is a significant part of the game), but it's not that big of a deal. Sometimes I would just make a jump to see what I could find. A few times it paid off. Other times, I fell into the abyss. Once I couldn't see what was on a platform I needed to jump to and a bookworm bit me. I think that was just a random glitch though because that area didn't have the same problem again. I never had any other technical concerns about the game. It's a rock-solid game.

Sometimes, the game switches to more of a 3D perspective instead of side-scrolling. It's rarely used. You can play an entire level with one camera style and suddenly the boss is in 3D mode, so that can be a bit counter-intuitive. It's slightly challenging to judge the depth of your jumps in this mode, but it's not that big of a deal.

I would recommend this game, but not at the $15 price point. It only takes about 2 hours to complete the story. Then you can repeat the levels of your choosing any time you want as time trials. Combined with a small system of collectibles, the game does present some replay value, though the collectible rewards aren't really that exciting.

8499400.review: I loved this game on the Mega Drive when I was young and still play it today. If you've never played it before it's a linear 2.5D platformer with some 3D sections, starring Mickey Mouse in all his cartoon glory. This update sticks fairly faithfully to the original, there are a few minor additions and re-imaginings of sections which make use of the 3D environment (the final boss is a good example of this). The controls are smooth, the music is great and the graphics are beautiful - the levels look like scenes painted in a particularly well-illustrated storybook, which is very much what the game is. It's not a long or particularly difficult game, bear in mind the original can be completed in about 20 minutes and I played this to 100% completion in a few hours. The replay value is the same as the original, this is the sort of game you pull off the shelf from time to time to while away an hour or two. Definitely worth snapping up when on sale.

8455177.review:
[h1]Atmosfera Disney ben realizzata [/h1]

E’ la rivisitazione dell' originale platform a 16 bit del 1990 realizzato per il mitico Sega Mega Drive, con l' aggiunta della terza dimensione. Proprio questa in alcuni frangenti sarà causa di malcontenti poichè i comandi non garantiscono di dominarla completamente; nulla che non sia migliorabile con la pratica comunque.

Storia: come da cliché fiabesco, Mickey Mouse è chiamato a liberare la sua bella, Minnie, dalla invidiosa e crudele strega Mizrabel; quest'ultima è mossa dall’obiettivo di strapparle la giovinezza. Per portare a termine l’impresa siamo chiamati ad affrontare diverse peripezie dislocate in varie locations -da raggiungere attraverso il castello, una sorta di hub del gioco- e recuperare le 7 Gemme dell’Arcobaleno.

Gameplay: molto semplice, senza abilità particolari a mostrare una visione personale del genere; si tratta per lo più di saltare a destra e a manca tar ostacoli e nemici. 
La vera novità rispetto all’originale è data dalla terza dimensione; di forte impatto estetico ma non senza qualche piccolo difetto all’implementazione nei sistemi di controllo. Discreta l’interazione con l’ambiente, con alcuni elementi statici ed altri precipui all’avanzamento come: tazze, carte da gioco, liane, eccc..

I.A: la difficoltà è tarata verso il basso. E’ uno di quei titoli che genitori e figli possono giocare insieme. 
Ma è apprezzabile anche da chi come il sottoscritto vuole immergersi nuovamente in una tenera età, intrisa della magia dei cartoni animati dell’azienda americana.

Comparto grafico: suggestive ambientazioni in salsa Walt Disney, non ricchissime di dettagli ma ispirate nei tratti. Foresta incantate, stanza ricca di giocattoli, luogo traboccante di dolciumi, ecc…

Comparto tecnico: texture in bassa definizione ma un buon frame-rate. I salti andavano studiati meglio nella rinnovata struttura tridimensionale, il sistema di collisioni non è preciso dimostrandosi come ostacolo indiretto per una difficoltà altrimenti blanda.

Comparto audio: buone le musiche, la colonna sonora è quella dell’originale

Commento finale: la longevità è bassa e la trama è scontata, ma questi aspetti sono bilanciati da una regia artistica davvero ispirata.
Il livello di sfida non elevato è adatto anche ai più piccini, e ai momenti di svago.

8348881.review:
Si vous avez eu un Sega Genesis en 1990, vous avez probablement joué à Castle of Illusion, un jeu de plateforme très apprécié à l'époque.  Si ce n'est pas votre cas, Sega vous propose une actualisation comme il s'en fait peu aujourd'hui. Tous les niveaux du jeu original ont été mis au goût du jour, de même que les ennemis et les gardiens.  Certaines arènes étant en 3D, quelques nouvelles mécaniques de jeu font leur apparition, pour rendre les combats contre les gardiens plus variés qu'autrefois. Cela dit, il est dommage que le jeu n'offre pas de niveaux supplémentaires. Vous sauverez aisément Minnie en-dedans de deux heures.  Si vous désirez récupérer tous les secrets de chacun des niveaux, vous passerez bien quelques heures de plus.  Cela dit, même si le jeu est simple, Mickey ne pouvant que sauter, s'accroupir ou lancer des projectiles, il n'est pas facile pour autant. En effet, les sauts à effectuer demandent de la précision, le jeu ne pardonne pas les erreurs.  D'ailleurs, lorsqu'on perd une vie, on ne revient pas à la vie avec une jauge d'énergie au maximum, mais bien au deux tiers, ce qui est plutôt punitif selon les standards d'aujourd'hui.

Points positifs

+ Superbe mise à jour visuelle du jeu original
+ Le narrateur apporte un plus sympa au jeu


Points négatifs

- Aucun nouveau niveau par rapport au jeu original
- Certaines cinématiques ne peuvent être sautées

8281997.review:
If you're into 2D platformers at all, you're pretty much going to want this as soon as possible. And I'm not talking the newfangled sort of platformer that's all about being mercilessly difficult by putting spikes everywhere. This is a real, genuine classic-style platformer, and it's fantastic. If you've played the original, it's worth getting for how much they've changed from the Genesis version. There's new levels, new bosses, the old levels have been expanded upon, or even changed completely.

If you haven't played the original Castle of Illusion, there's a lot here if you like 2D platformers. The platforming itself is really well done, and the game itself never gets unfairly hard. In fact, it's pretty easy up until the final stages, where you might have to spend a couple of continues. There's also a few parts where the game goes into 3D, which never last for long, but are used for a lot of interesting level setpieces. It also looks fantastic, although the new soundtrack is sadly pretty generic. Personally, I prefer the classic soundtrack, but that's just me!

Basically, if you want a platformer that's made the way that platformers USED to be, go for this.

8265742.review: While having never played the original, I can definitely find enjoyment in the simplistic controls of Castle of Illusion. There's very little to do rather than move a left analog stick and press a button or two. Yet, the "Disney-ness" of Disney's graphics - especially Mickey Mouse himself, who has lost none of his charm over the years - as well as the story of the game told through a magical bodiless narrator really add to the whole storybook feel of this game. And it truly does feel like a storybook at times. The voice actor for Mizrabel definitely played her part very well. I do wish there was a tad bit more replayability rather than having the existing levels simply timed, or collecting all of the gems. Additionally, I dislike how third parties have to solve the game's issues concerning 30fps and failure to fully support high resolutions, but these are more minor complaints that far too many people have brought up.  All in all, Castle of Illusion was a nice return to classical gameplay of olden years that I never enjoyed as a kid. I would suggest this to any child gamer, as well as any adult who enjoys games with charm like this every once in a while.

Not a bad pick if you have younger children that are cutting their teeth as gamers. My four year old daughter enjoys this one. That said I still have two less than stellar points to share with anyone reading this. First, the game was completed on a first run in a matter of a few hours of gameplay that were almost exclusively my 4 year old at the helm (with the occasional help from dad). Second, this game suffers from a broken difficulty curve - as in difficulty is not present until the final boss fight at which point boss patterns for younger players (the target audience I would hope) jump up ridiculously. 

Again, those two points still present, my daughter is finding replay value in it so as a $5 bin purchase with Disney licensing I'll give it a thumbs up. For much more than that I probably would save my money and spend it elsewhere.

8232872.review:
Bem, é difícil falar de um jogo de Mega Drive que traz tão boas lembranças de minha infância e de muita gente - com imparcialidade. Não quero fazer uma análise, mas sim deixar claro minhas impressões com essa obra, sim não adianta reclamar, é uma obra de ARTE, afinal não foi no remake que a ideia do traço Disney se perdeu!
Elogiar seria muito mais fácil, quero apenas citar alguns pontos que me irritaram no gameplay, como:
Jogabilidade: 
É incrível que essa jogabilidade tenha ficado tão dura assim! Acharam um motor pra simular a física no lixo? Fiz questão de baixar um ROM do gênesis pra testar se a jogabilidade era tão ruim assim no MEGA - realmente não me lembrava mais. Pra minha surpresa, no emulador os movimentos são suaves. Droga! Por que “Sega Studios Australia”, por que?

Duração: 
Não tinha como ser tão grande assim, mas achei que foi ridículo 4,5hs. Eu vivi esse momento nostálgico com meus filhos, jogamos juntos e olha que ele erravam bastante. Pra surpresa de todos o jogo se passou num piscar de olhos. Já acabou papai? - Perguntou meu filho achando rápido demais da conta.

Fator Replay: 
Nossa cara! 12 conquistas meia boca, apenas isso pra ter fazer querer jogar novamente. (destas ganhei 6 no primeiro game play) e nada de unlockables. 
Me permita fazer um comparativo: Ducktales Remastered, feito pela WayForward, ficou show se comparado a ao jogo do camundongo. Tem um monte de unlockables como: artes conceituais, músicas da jornada para ouvir ou para usar na campanha ao som de 8bits, fotos dos personagens... Isso deu vontade de jogar mais um pouco só pra juntar grana e comprar, ver e ouvir mais desta galeria.

Veredito: Sim, ainda vale muito apena!
Seria injusto dizer que ele é um “castelo de desilusões”. Tanto pra nós, oldschool, e pra molecada jovem, posso dizer que ele proporciona poucas, mas boas horas de diversão.

7897598.review:
As a fanatic of the sega genesis version, I was hesitating  at getting this game, bc I read bad reviews since it was released , but  nostalgia beat me and I had to put my hands on it and here's my humble review.
 
To start off, this game has "+" and "-" and sadly more " - " than "+":

cons:

- The control  of mickey is different, but ackward different, it doesn't feel like in the classic version.
- The game is is TOO short! you can easily beat it off in a couple of hours if you rush it up.I managed to beat it off (full achievments complete) in just  a few hours, and I'm not even a hardcore player!
- The plot, as usual it's a Disney story, very plain and simple, but they could take advantage of it to create  some kind of plot twist to make the game last longer. 
- Too damn easy!!! Ok, this could be more a bit of subjetive opinion, but I really found harder the classic version, maybe bc I was a kid back in the 90's and found some parts of the game really frustrating  to go through, even though it had the right amount of difficulty to get back at it and make you want to play all over and over again. Although with this one, well is easy, I admit that a the candy dragon boss and mizrabel gave me some tough time but once I figured out their pattern attack, it was easier. Aside from that, there's no real challenge, I think they set the difficulty of this game for nowadays kids as they use to complain for high difficulty in games. This one is a very big con bc I excepted more challenge.

pros: 

+ AWESOME music! the BGM and SE of this game are very very good,  the old songs are all remasterized  and recomposed and they did a good work at updating them with digital music and sounds, this was a bull's eye!
+ Graphics: what can I say? just stunning! they're beautiful, If the original japanese sega crew could have access to nowadays technology to create such graphics back in the 90's , they surely could had came up with something similar to this. The redesign of the levels are very well excecuted as well, they keep the spirit of the original version. Just Bravo!

As a conclusion, I might say that I'm aware that the studio that did this game wanted to keep the spirit of the orinigal COI, and didn't want to change much elements in order to do so, but really, this game could have been a bit longer, with more levels (and bosses). A true shame! but it's still enjoyable and fun to play. If you didn't play the sega genesis version, then go ahead and play! but if you're a fanatic of the classic version  like me, you' ll be dessapointing of it when you'll beat it as there's no real challenge.

If you want a real challenge, then you can download a sega genesis emulator along with the COI rom or undust your old sega genesis and original COI and beat it! bc with this one, you won't get any.

7841024.review:
Bom, a princípio Castle of Illusion parecia uma boa idéia. Dublagem foi aplicada, as fases ganharam nova roupagem, de acordo com tecnologia de hoje, novos desafios além de pular plataformas foram adicionados, aproveitando as capacidades 3D que não estavam lá na época do Mega Drive, e com isso as lutas de chefe tamnbém ganharam estilo novo e muito divertido.

Porém algo que acontece muito hoje em dia estragou todo esse grande trabalho: os desenvolvedores esquecem que eles também são gente e também jogam videogames, e ao invés de fazerem algo que ELES MESMOS gostariam de usar, se concentram em quanto tempo os jogadores gastarão com o jogo deles, não jogando de outros desenvolvedores. Por isso artificialmente tornam seu jogo mais complicado do que deveria.

Isso em CoI se traduz na física fora de lugar do jogo. Mickey acelera demais quando não deveria, falta velocidade onde era necessãria, e pior de tudo a velocidade de queda é absurdamente alterada pela gravidade, tornando alguns saltos simples quase impossíveis, por falta de tempo. Tudo isso se traduz em fazer o jogador repetir inúmeras vezes a mesma fase até adquirir reflexo motor perfeito, pra fazer os saltos na hora exata. Não é divertido repetir a mesma coisa até aprender a se portar como um robô.

Apesar da física absurda e frustrante tem MUITA coisa no mundo do jogo que consegue espremer diversão da frustração que é não conseguir acertar os simples movimentos.

7816182.review:
Introduction:

In this game you collect diamonds and different colored gems that eventually build what the narrator calls the (rainbow bridge). Now, I'm not sure if that was apart of the original game, but the rainbow bridge to confront the final boss almost reminds me of Ocarina of Time going into Ganon's Castle. Also, collecting the diamonds also reminds me of Banjo Kazooie opening the Note Doors. I'm not saying the game is copying those titles, but it reminds me of it; heck it might've even been in the original, but I haven't a clue if it does. I also forgot to mention that the narrator is the same guy who plays Victor Sullivan from the Uncharted games!

Verdict:

I might be a little biased here due to being able to play as Mickey friggin' Mouse, so just read on how I think Castle of Illusion is a really fun game. I personally have never played the original game, but I guess as a gamer who enjoys platform titles this game caught my attention even more so. I might not have had the best experience due to have a really low end PC (even lower than the minimum requirements), but it was still enjoyable. I bet it's even better when you're running on a better rig than my own. Everything in this game has that Disney charm and I greatly appreciate that as a guy who grew up watching Disney movies and cartoons. Due to only have played this version of Castle of Illusion I don't have much complaints except that the controls could feel a lot smoother (reading other peoples reviews that seems to be the most common complaint).

Extra:

I've personally only beaten the first area of the game, and from checking out other reviews for the game apparently it is about 2 hours long. I guess playing for about 50 minutes shows you how bad my laptop is.

7777140.review:
Castle of Illusion is absolutely one of my favorite games on the Sega Genesis - the music and the feel really stuck with me from those days. The tree level with the spiders still stands out today for showing the power of what that platform could do, both from graphics and sound/music design perspectives.  

This remake has taken the bones of that game and given it a facelift, without destroying the spirit of the original. You can even run it with original music, although the new soundtrack is very much akin to the way in which the graphics were updated and sounds great in its own right. 

Still haven't finished it, as it's one of those games I pick up for a casual quick stroll when I don't have time for a long gaming session, but its been well done so far. 

If you like sidescrolling platformers, this is a decent deal at 15 bucks, but a no-brainer on sale for <=$10. 

Pros: Fantastic look, good sound design, controls are well done (especially with a control pad)

Cons: Could do without the level introduction narrator; some of the original levels are "optional" areas now - such as the aforementioned tree/spider level (which is now accessed optionally through a doorway in a tree, rather than just being a stage in the first area)

7764078.review: Esse eu me sinto na obrigação de recomendar, aliás é mais que uma recomendação é uma declaração para com o jogo kkkkk em nome da minha infancia, horas e mais horas jogando, aluguei tanto a fita que o cara da locadora me vendeu ela de uma vez haohsoa, era um dos meus jogos favoritos de Mega drive  na épóca era bem dificil  zerar porque não tinha tanta facilidade quanto nessa nova versão, a trilha sonora que já era ótima agora  é espetacular manteram coisas, sons, detalhes, adcionaram efeitos nos ambientes, entre outras coisas que não tinhamos na versão da decada de 90, mas que não afetaram negativamente, pelo contrário foi tão boa as coisas que acrescentaram no Game que o fez ser ainda melhor, as  lutas com os chefes em vez de serem tediosas, dificil com alguns eram, o jogo faz com as mesmas se tornem super legais [ em certos momento nem notei dificuldade  kk, tirando a Bruxa no final que é apelona que só kkkk ], talvez pelos gráficos de agora ? mas creio que não, o  jogo não precisava de gráficos pra ser ótimo, e foi um grande clássico, e ver o mesmo   tão bonito agora, com tanto capricho é bom demais *0* nem da pra explicar, só quem teve o Game presente na sua infancia entende é tudo muito nostalgico, Merece 10 em tudo (coisa que muitos jogos atuais não são dignos de merecer ) Jogabilidade, história, música, e gráficos que está muito lindão, de certa forma achei mais fácil que o original mas não tem problema não tiro ponto algum do jogo por isso.

As a fan of the original Genesis/MegaDrive game, this was everything I wanted from a remake. Great gameplay and music, levels and bosses reworked enough to keep it fresh, and beautiful, fluid, cartoon-like graphics.

There are, however, issues with this game being a sloppy port stuck at 720p/30fps. Luckily the resolution and framerate have been fixed/hacked by the community. It's also been updated a couple times since I last played, so the issues might have been fixed by now. Regardless, the PC Gaming Wiki page should have any info you need to get it running right and it looks incredible at 1080p/60fps. As I recall you might want to force AA and AF through your video card for optimal visuals.
http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Castle_of_Illusion

812632.review:
The original Castle of Illusion was an easy-going platformer with loads of character and memorable moments, and this reimagining is much the same. Game is PRETTY - it's like playing a Mickey cartoon! All the worlds are modelled beautifully, and Mickey's animations really stand out. His little "haters gonna hate" strut is adorable.

The game is pretty laid back however, so if you've played a platformer in the past twenty years, you shouldn't have much trouble getting to the end. It's also a bit old-fashioned - it plays almost exactly like the original, with some collectibles and unlockable extras tucked away to nudge you into playing levels again to find something you might have overlooked. As a result, it might leave you wanting for more if you're too used to more feature-packed games.

That being said, I do recommend CoI. It's worth playing the original game too, as it still holds up pretty well!

3923022.review:
OK, I just finished the Castle of Illusion remake: it's a firm 10/10. I've got a little more to do before it's 100% clear, but it's yet another candidate for my Game of the Year.

Castle of Illusion (the Master System version) is a game I counted as my favourite since I was around five or six years old until recently when The Binding of Isaac challenged it, but Castle of Illusion is rock-solid and Binding is buggy as heck; it's still great, but Castle pips it by virtue of being faultless, basically.

So this remake was a long time coming and something I had a lot of nostalgic and, frankly, emotional stake in. The remake is actually of the Mega Drive version of the game (which I don't like as much but is still a good crack), but the principle is thus; the "...of Illusion" series is very dear to me, and this remake is more than worthy. It take the basic elements of both versions of the original game and expands upon them sensibly and non-intrusively. The spirit, the feel of the game is bang on. It's incredible just how charming this remake is, and how perfectly it nails the Illusion magic. It makes the recent 3DS Epic Mickey: The Power of Illusion look even more like the insult it was. Screw Dreamrift for daring to put the word "Illusion" on their piece of shit game.

This remake is perfect. Sure, it's taken me just shy of two hours to finish it, but those were two hours where at no point did I say "for fuck's sake", two hours I spent grinning like a loon, completely enraptured by the sheer friendliness of the game. Ten out of ten, everyone should play this. The studio have disbanded so there will not be a sequel and if there is it's a risky proposition. This was a once-in-a-lifetime thing and Sega Studios Australia pulled it off with incredible fucking skill. Props to them and I hope their staff all find success at whatever they do.

Castle of Illusion (2013) reminded me that video games can be as fun, charming and engaging as they were when I was ten, playing cartridges my uncle brought me home from the market. So, bless it for that.

1090952.review:
Castle of Illusion is a great remake of the original 1990 version, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse for SEGA Genesis. Offering beautiful 3D graphics, a completely enhanced soundtrack and Steam achievements.

You will also find a lot of extra places to visit and secrets to find. There is also a voice narrative that tells the story throughout the game.

Castle of Illusion is a real treat for anyone who loved playing the original game. Kudos to Disney and SEGA for bringing us this great game! :)
